reviews.text: Lack of coordination between initial greeter and second level greeters. 8PM reservation was ready at 8:15pm and we were only offered an outside table with no heat lamp on a cold evening. Call ahead and insist on the seating you desire.

It&#39;s my husband&#39;s birthday so where else best to  celebrate them but to the famous &#39;Cheesecake Factory, it took us a bit of a drive to come in here coming from Maricopa, but it&#39;s well worth it. We walk-in the restaurant and we were warmly greeted by two young ladies that immediately seated us to a huge, nice, and comfortable booth all to ourselves.  The last time we visited this establishment was in Reno on Rick&#39;s promotion, today it&#39;s Rick&#39;s birthday we are celebrating  and I&#39;m glad to say it&#39;s a good choice.  We peruse their notebook like menu and view the extensive listings of food and libations and two long pages of cheesecake assortments and other desserts.  We decided to order from their Lunch Specials which we were told by our friendly and accommodating server named Kaylee is serve in big portions, she was not kidding I took photos for everyone to see. She started inquiring  of our desired libations, and we proceeded on ordering our meal.  I had chosen the &#39;Chicken Piccatta&#39; - the sautéed chicken breast was tender the angel hair was soaked on this amazing piccata sauce with lemon and capers, such a dreamy comfort food, it&#39;s so good I have a new &#39;go to&#39; food.  My dearest spouse decided to have their flat bread &#39;Molto Meat&#39; pizza with green salad.  The pizza had a good flatbread and the meat on top we&#39;re delicious as well, there was a compilation of prosciutto, sausage, homemade meatballs, pepperoni and smoke bacon smothered with Parmesan and mozzarella cheese with tomato sauce base - what an awesome overall meal.  By the time we were half way done, we can barely lift our fork for another bite, so bountiful meal and so deliciously comforting.  Since we are celebrating  a birthday  we decided to have their &#39;pineapple upside down cheesecake .  The cheesecake melts in your mouth and as we daintily devour them, the lingering pineapple taste stayed in our palate demanding for more.  Overall our dining experience was great and a good one to celebrate  my husbands birthday

This cheesecake factory was right on par with every other one i&#39;d ever been to. The only thing is that the orange chicken is a little off on the batter. This place has like a million options for the menu, so it can make you change your mind several times when your picking. Great portion sizes

Just left about 30 minutes ago.. didn&#39;t have a reservation but was immediately seated. Heck yes!! We&#39;ve been waiting all week to come so I was pretty excited that we got sat right away. Scanned the QR, browsed the menu, decided on my food, talked to the others in my group about what we all were going to get, reopened the menu, and then chose what cheesecake I was going to have for dessert. If you&#39;ve ever been to a Cheesecake Factory, you know that the menu is intense. The fact I was able to read the entire menu and then debate about it without ever being greeted my a server gives you an idea of how long we were sitting there. I&#39;m not sure what happened, if we were forgotten about or what but we ultimately decided to leave. Just left Whole Foods with all the ingredients I need to have yet another stay at home dinner.

Once upon a time, back in the 90s, this building was Planet Hollywood. Back when Planet Hollywood had multiple locations all over the place. Although I guess that&#39;s irrelevant now. Anyway, Cheesecake Factory is one of those places, much like Olive Garden, that I might visit once per year - not necessarily as a desire, but simply because I received a gift card for the restaurant.<br><br>It&#39;s funny, because I always read these articles about Cheesecake Factory struggling, but yet, their parking lots are always jam packed with customers. A family I work with considers them their default choice for celebrations, so clearly the place has its appeal to certain folk.<br><br>Their menu, quite frankly, really freaks me out. Not necessarily because of the caloric content that they often get criticized for, but the sheer size of it. There&#39;s really no real sense of direction with the menu, as it&#39;s almost if they&#39;re trying to cover virtually everything imaginable. If they specialize in something other than cheesecake, I&#39;m not entirely sure what it is.<br><br>Anyway, I decided to play it safe and ordered an old fashion burger, while my girlfriend ordered half a chicken salad sandwich, which was more than enough to feed one (normal) person. I substituted out their fries with a side of mac and cheese.<br><br>Overall, I found my burger to be comparable to what you&#39;d find at most chain restaurants. Not particularly great, but not really bad either. The mac and cheese was a bit on the bland side, while my girlfriend wasn&#39;t really impressed with her chicken sandwich in comparison to some of the great ones she&#39;s had at some local establishments. She claimed it was just a bunch of mayo, very few almonds, and didn&#39;t really taste like chicken breast. The lukewarm (loaded) potato soup was mediocre at best. On the plus side, we&#39;ve both always enjoyed Cheesecake&#39;s complimentary hot bread and butter.<br><br>Now, as for cheesecake, I&#39;ve never really been a fan in its traditional form. However, there&#39;s a ridiculous amount of creations here for dessert, to the point where most people can find something that they&#39;ll like. Years ago, I&#39;d default to their Chocolate Tuxedo, but we decided to take a risk and go with their Hazlenut Crunch, which is topped with Nutella. It was actually decent and as good as I remember their cakes being, so that&#39;s one thing that I feel this place can deliver on.<br><br>Our server was very friendly and chatty, more than happy to provide her opinions on some of our menu choices. We definitely have no complaints there.<br><br>Overall, Cheesecake Factory is what it is. It will never be a place I&#39;d visit regularly, but I think that for an occasional visit, it&#39;s perfectly fine. <br><br>And as for their fans, I&#39;d imagine that it&#39;s virtually impossible to get bored with their extensive menu.

Out of all the Cheesecake Factory locations, this one is probably the most disappointing I have visited.  Since I work nearby, I have dined in 3 or 4 times, each time service has been lacking and food prep time unusually slow.  My most recent visit, it took us 40 minutes to receive two appetizers without an update from our server that there was any kind of delay.  I have also done take out orders where the employee is annoyed and short.<br><br>Food is standard and good, but I think raising the standard of customer service is a big one here.

They missed the side of mashed potatoes with my entree, but at least they were nice enough to refund me that amount. THIS IS WHERE I GET HEATED! The portions sizes are RIDICULOUSLY! SMALL! Every time I dine in, the portion sizes are decently big, but when you order takeout they skimp out on the food. My whole family of 5 finished food in less than 5 minutes and wondered what happened. For the price we paid, I expected more food. We will not be coming back, you lost a customer.
Never answer the phone!!! I was on hold for 30 minutes and nobody ever picked up. I needed to cancel my reservation but it wouldn&#39;t let me do it online. Very unhappy.

I&#39;ve never been a huge fan of Cheesecake Factory, likely because I&#39;m vegan, but the addition of the Impossible burger has been a total game changer. First, kudos to the restaurant for making the entire burger vegan (i.e., vegan cheese and sauce). Nothing is worse than finding a supposedly vegan option on a menu and finding there is no option for vegan cheese or condiments. I was able to omit the bun and instead have the burger prepared with a lettuce wrap to make it gluten free, and it was AMAZING! My fiancé had the regular burger, and said my Impossible burger was better. The fries that accompanied the burger also were really crispy and fresh. <br><br>The thing that would have made our experience even better would have been a gluten free beer option. I ended up ordering a Truly (spiked seltzer), but would have preferred a beer to go with my burger and fries. I also would really love to see a vegan and gluten free cheesecake added to the menu. Hopefully that will be an option in the near future.<br><br>Overall, this is a nice Cheesecake Factory with a great location in the heart of the Biltmore. We love the proximity to our condo and having the ability to walk if we decide to have a few cocktails with our meal. They also deliver through Door Dash if you prefer to dine in. We definitely will be back for the Impossible burger in the near future.

Ordered and paid for a red velvet cheesecake for my daughter&#39;s 21st birthday for $59. When I got home with the cake I reached out to the restaurant to tell them that the cake was damaged and half way crushed on the one side. I asked for someone to reach out to me and the Manager a Daniel Anders reached out to me apologizing but no solutions. We frequented the restaurant but will never go back....

Went with friends for happy hour! Many appetizers, which could be a meal, are very reasonablely  priced. Service was excellent and very informative with the happy hour menu. Of course we ended the meal with a slice of upside down pineapple cheesecake!
Amazing service! I love coming here even when it&#39;s busy. Very romantic for special occasions.
Excellent service, everything about the meal was fantastic except for the burger.<br>Our waitress fixed that promptly which was very appreciated.

I opted for a late dinner at The Cheesecake Factory. Upon entry we were seated quickly. I love a dimmed dining room but it was a shade too dark last night. Our server was just okay. He was pre-occupied with preparing for the restaurant to close. As a result he forgot some condiments we requested. I really don&#39;t like the menu it&#39;s too many options for me so I just stick to what I&#39;m familiar with.  Our food arrived promptly at the correct temperature it was seasoned well and taste great. The honey mustard sauce I used to dip my cajun chicken littles was yummy. No room for dessert next time!

I have a love hate relationship with the cheesecake factory. We all know what we&#39;re getting when we go here. I&#39;ve been going to cheesecake factories all my life. The food definitely isn&#39;t bad. The portions are giant. The prices are high (but probably not considering the size of the portions...but really....I&#39;d love to be able to order a half portion at a discount price). Their menu is overwhelming. We go here a lot for family affairs, and it&#39;s fine for that. If given the choice though, I&#39;d probably go elsewhere.
Good distancing.<br>Full menu.<br>Staff adhering to guidelines for safety.<br>Staff is friendly and helpful.<br>Yelp reservations are a BREEZE to use!

Another carbon copy of all the other cheesecake eateries. At certain times of the week this place can be packed. However, if you arrive just before closing time on a Sunday night, you won&#39;t have to wait to buy your favorite cheesecake to take home and savor.<br><br>This Cheesecake Factory is situated in the Biltmore mall on Camelback. If you crave cheesecake this is the right place to come.<br><br>If you are counting calories (oh dear, wrong restaurant!) let someone else read the menu and then you probably should skip everything that they have on the menu.  Almost every slice of cheesecake is a gazillion calories.<br><br>The wait people were very personable and helpful, even right before closing time.

I know they are trying to do a service by listing the calories of each of the cheesecakes, but I&#39;d prefer not know. At first I was hoping that the whole cheesecake was over 1,000 calories, but alas no, that&#39;s just one piece. And, I should learn to just half the slice and share it, so then it&#39;s like only 500 calories (ugh). Maybe, I should half the half to get to the calories that I should have for a slice, but nah, let&#39;s just eat the whole thing (slice not cake).<br><br>I&#39;m definitely a fan of the cheesecake here, but I&#39;m just not such a fan of the calorie intake on a slice of cheesecake even though it tastes sooooo good. <br><br>And, there are some mouth-watering flavors by the cake or by the slice. Since it was my daughter&#39;s birthday, she chose the flavor--white chocolate raspberry truffle. But, that mango key lime looked delicious and so did the salted caramel. Oh, let&#39;s just face facts, they ALL looked delicious.

Me and my girlfriend picked up a dinner from there last Friday they charge us 2 time I contact the manager and he&#39;s said I will take care of it never did don&#39;t trust the palace with ur Credit card

Went for lunch on a glorious Spring Friday. Sat on the small outside patio. Service was outstanding. Ordered two teas and two appetizers to share. Our selections were the chicken taquitos and chicken potstickers. For those of you that have never dined here be prepared to read the novel they call a menu. It&#39;s actually a little overwhelming and is probably a reason why their prices  are on the high side.<br><br>Waitress took our order and asked if we wanted bread, which we declined but it&#39;s a nice gesture. Food arrived fairly quickly and was pleasing to the eye. The taquitos were actually two whole cut into four pieces with a very tasty green salsa on the bottom of the plate with a drizzle of a avocado based sauce and a sprinkling of Pico on top. These little bites were perfect in every way. Crispy, a little spicy. I would order these as a entrée next visit so I wouldn&#39;t have to share. The chicken potstickers looked great too. A slight golden brown crust on two sides placed in a large bowl with a thin asian inspired soy ginger sauce. The sauce was amazing, I could have drank it. Even though they were cooked perfectly I wish the chicken stuffing, though plentiful wasn&#39;t spiced enough for me. They needed more ginger or garlic...something to give them a little more umph.<br><br>Overall it was a good dining experience, I do think for the portion size the value wasn&#39;t really a bargain.<br><br>I love how the menu has calorie counts for those watching what they eat. $27 and change was our total without tip.

I went to the Cheesecake Factory for lunch with friends, but wasn&#39;t sure what I would get. It was nice to discover an item marked as vegan on the menu - the vegan cobb salad. The salad was tasty, but way too big and too expensive! And salad doesn&#39;t do well as leftovers. The beets and chick peas were my favorite of the veggies on it. The lettuce was fairly lame - mostly iceberg, but the dressing was okay. <br><br>They also had the Impossible Burger, but it didn&#39;t look like the bun was vegan and the server didn&#39;t point it out when I said I was vegan and asked for suggestions. There was also a pasta I could veganize, but a salad seemed easier.<br><br>Our server was great - just the right level of attention. Overall it was a fine experience, but I wouldn&#39;t go out of my way to eat there.

I have so many fond memories of this (Biltmore) and the Kierland Cheesecake Factory locations from many years ago... Back in the day, I didn&#39;t mind eating at chains, but now when I dine out, I prefer to eat at more locally owned establishments.  That being said, there&#39;s always a time and place for a visit to a chain.  One of those times was last week, when my husband and I were gifted a Cheesecake Factory gift card from my parents (thanks Mom and Dad) in honor of our anniversary!<br><br>We took the kids and headed over and I was admittedly excited.  I told my kids about the large menu, the fabulous food, the tasty lemonade, and the delicious desserts... <br><br>We were seated on the side patio upon request, which was great, and we had a decent experience.  The reason it was decent (3 stars) and not all that (5 stars)?  <br><br>Well... the service wasn&#39;t as friendly as I remembered it being.  It was also on the slow side.  My omelette came out wrong, so by the time they corrected it, my family was almost done with their food.  It also needed salt, which was missing from our table, but I figured it may take awhile to get, so I did without it.  <br><br>Everyone else enjoyed their food, and once mine arrived, it was good, albeit it could have used some salt ;).  The lemonade was as good as I remember... go for an Arnold Palmer!  And of course the cheesecake won&#39;t disappoint.  We went for the original on our visit.  I am also a fan of their carrot cake, which I plan to get if/when we return.<br><br>There is something for everyone here, which is the big reason to go... just keep your expectations in check and you&#39;ll be fine!

This review is only for the chocolate Godiva gluten free cheesecake. It was safe, incredibly rich and incredibly sweet. The cheese portion of the cake tasted and felt more like mousse. It was good nonetheless. One piece goes a long way.

Hard to really perfect dishes when there are an excessive amount on the menu. Main food is mediocre at best and not worth the excessive amount of calories most dishes contain. If the name doesn&#39;t give it away, the only reason to come is the cheesecake, at least that&#39;s one area you can&#39;t go wrong!

Marginally average.  Food was ok,  but nothing special.  The real issue is the outdated,  worn and dirty decor. While this may have been a nice atmosphere when the opened in the 1990s, the lack of any maintenance or upgrading could be seen in the pathetically small booths with torn or missing vinyl on the seats.   Everything felt a bit dirty and a lot uncared for.  <br><br>While once probably a nice go to location,  the Camelback Cheesecake Factory felt more like Denny&#39;s older brother,  attracting the budget minded (although pricey menu- but there are generous portions).<br><br>Certainly won&#39;t make our dining rotation.  Too many really good choices at the same price point.

My husband and I had date night here earlier in the week, and we had a great time. We ordered drinks, a pineapple moscow mule and an ipa - which both were great. <br><br>The menu has definitely expanded since the last time the two of us had been there, which made the selection process very difficult - haha. We ordered the fried calamari to start, which came out with this thick garlic sauce, almost butter like, which was fantastic. The cool on the calamari was perfect. <br><br>For our dinner, we ordered three small plates that we could share, which was so worth it. The fried cheese, mashed potato tots, and empanadas were amazing! Can you tell it was cheat day for us? Haha. Everything came out promptly, our server was so nice and was on top of her game. <br><br>We ordered dessert to go since we were full by the end, but our experience was great. Parking here is hard to find since it&#39;s in a shopping center, but the whole area is clean and well kept. The restaurant itself was clean, but I had forgotten how dark it is inside! Would recommend for a splurge night / date night, it is a bit pricey.

TERRIBLE!!!  We went for our Valentines Day dinner, the hostess (who was rude) tried to sit us in the bar in a crammed little table, there were booths available in the dining area so we asked to sit there, she stated it would be a 10 to 15 minute wait, which we were fine with.  As 10 minutes go by, another couple walks in and gets seated ahead of us, in the Dining area.  We went back up to the hostess and asked if she forgot about us seeing as she was seating people ahead of us, she snotty said, &#34;no!&#34;<br>The Manager happened to be right there, so he said he was sorry and seated us.  We ordered, the waitress messed up my guys order, fries were stale, steak was tough, my grilled chicken had bones in it and the pasta was hard.  $80.00 for crappy service and gross food!  NEVER AGAIN

The best place for food &amp; all different desserts.<br>Had the Ghiradelli cherry cheesecake it was amazing. Came with fudge filling &amp; chocolate cherries &amp; cookie crust. Atmosphere is great, &amp; staff.

I have dreamt of many things in here but it was nothing like that except for the wait time which was less than 2 mins.. also we timed so that we don&#39;t have to wait for long.<br><br>Ordered a couple of things.. but their bread though which was amazing and the 3 stars goes to that.<br>But otherwise their pasta was OK Ok and also their white chicken with rice has a weird taste to the gravy .. not good at all.<br><br>Of course if you are here, the cheesecake has to be the dessert and we ordered the carrot cake flavour which was fine.. but it wasn&#39;t as expected (a bit on the dry side)
I never leave bad reviews. From the host&#39;s to the server  to  the food. I will not go back<br>1 star is being  nice.  To bad I love the deserts.

After shopping every aisle in Macy&#39;s we got a little hungry. Cheesecake Factory was right around the corner so we took a short stroll over.  <br> I was greeted right away with a smile and seated right away.  It was mid afternoon and there were only 7 other guests.  My waiter arrived at the table within a minute and took my order.  I got the egg roll sampler. <br> 15 minutes later the food arrived, which I don&#39;t think is bad for a wait. The presentation on the plate was great.  The taste, nah. Jack in the Box egg rolls are better, and cost less. <br> I&#39;ll probably go again, but only for the desserts...not so much for the lunch/dinner menu.<br>  The atmosphere was relatively quiet which I like. And the service was alright as well.

The food here is alright. Tried the fried mac&#39;n&#39; cheese comes with I believe 4-5 &#34;balls&#34; of the fried mac&#39;n&#39; cheese. The breadIng is a thick layer, like frozen friend food. The appetizer pizzas are good and same woth the sparklers (tried the guava  blood orange). One thing I would not pay for there ever again are the margaritas. Ordered one and the presentation was extremely plain for it being $13. Also didn&#39;t have enough alcohol. The cheesecake is delicious though!
Food was cold and some things were overcooked. I will not order from here again. For the price, I would only eat at the restaurant.
First time using curbside service; horrible experience! Nearly 30 minutes late and still waiting from the scheduled pickup time.

Cheesecake Factory has always been the best restaurant for my family to go to because everyone is usually able to find something something they like with the variety of the menu. However, this visit just disappointed everyone and has truly changed our view of Cheesecake Factory. Our server was great, she had the best manners and always got everything we needed, whether it was straws for waters or giving us the freshest bread that was given to us right as we sat down. <br><br>What really put a damper on the visit was the quality of the dishes. My daughters ordered two chipotle chicken pastas and one Santa Fe salad while I ordered the Cobb Salad. I was very disappointed with what we ended up getting because the pasta was so firm and needed to be cooked more because when you bit on it, it was still so hard and very dry. It felt like no sauce was put on the pasta. On top of it the Cobb salad was so flavorless and gross. It felt like I was just eating dull lettuce that had no crunch or flavor to it at all. I expected a higher quality from Cheesecake Factory especially for their prices. The only good thing that came from the visit were the two cheesecakes that we ended up ordering because we barely touched the food we actually ordered. You can never go wrong with cheesecake, and after paying for the meal and dessert, we left feeling kind of empty, unsatisfied, but full mostly off of cheesecake. I wish the visit could have been better since we were also celebrating my daughters last night in town before she had to go out of state for a while.

I ordered to go tonight after getting off work at 830. Got tuna takaki salad. The portion is super small for a $20 salad. The cheesecake for $9 and you get a tiny slice of cake and a bunch of cool whip. Should be call cool whip cake. Won&#39;t be back. So disappointed.
Wrote in about getting the wrong to go food and they made it right instantly, customer service is definitely a 5!

I realize that things have changed because of the pandemic, but it took three tries for them to even answer the phone at this location and once they finally did, I was on hold for exactly 23 minutes before I gave up and hung up.   Even fastfood restaurants weren&#39;t this ill prepared.  If they can&#39;t even answer the phone, I can&#39;t imagine what it&#39;s like to actually eat there in person.

Fresh bread, delicious salads and of course the cheesecake is to die for! My husband had the Renee lunch special with chicken tortilla soup. I had a beet with goat cheese salad and I added a chicken breast to it. Loved the food and lunch prices ! Good service too!

I liked the carrot cake here at Cheese Cake factory.  Even though I don&#39;t stop to eat lunch or dinner I will stop for their carrot cake. <br>Today stopped  and I saw the counter lady pull a piece from a refrigerator behind her. I asked her is it fresh, she didn&#39;t answer me but gave me strang look. I asked again is it fresh, she still didnt answer me, so I asked again..is the cake fresh..she finally gave an answer yes since this morning . I thought impossible you just opened.  <br>I took it home and you could tell it wasn&#39;t fresh the texture was not that of a fresh cake. <br>Very disappointed...not stopping anymore.

We were dining in and were served a glass of water with a Cheesecake Factory napkin in it and a plastic to go cup lid! My son drank out of it before we noticed it and so we showed it to our server. The manager came over - did not apologize- and asked if we needed a new water?!? At the end of the meal as we were getting ready to pay we asked if they figured out how that happened and they said no one there put it in the cup and intimated that we had put it in ourselves! When we commented on how ludicrous that was and at the very least they could apologize the manager again be an very defensive and said they  could not have possibly been them. Where would we get a Cheesecake Factory napkin and to go lid and why would we out it in our child&#39;s drink? We did not ask for anything on our bill to be comped we just wanted an apology and to not be accused of such a ridiculous act!! Prior to this we were regulars at This restaurant but now we will not return.
What can I say? It&#39;s a nationally recognized chain with pages and pages of amazing entrees and an endless list of sweets.  Always a good time. Portions are huge.

I came here to have a Christmas dinner for work and the hostess greeted us right away and told us it would be about 20 minutes because we arrived early. She was kind enough to keep us updated on our tables and they would take us back shortly. As soon as we were taken to our table our waitress greeted us and asked for our drink selection. Considering there was 13 of us the drinks came out really fast and no mistakes. She then took all of our orders and was very friendly. I ordered the filet mignon medium with veggies and mashed potatoes. Everything was cooked exactly as i ordered and let me say i cleaned off the plate. We all then ordered cheesecake to go and they have an extensive selection on cheesecakes. That by far was the hardest part to decide which one i wanted. I really enjoyed it here and will be back to try other foods from their endless menu choices. <br><br>This location in particular can validate your parking so make sure to take your chip in with you.

I just want to start by saying that this is the first negative review on a restaurant I have ever given. The food was perfect as always, the service was amazing, so what was the problem? The two tables closest to ours the other patrons walked by our table multiple times without masks. On one of the occasions they stood right next to our table talking to their waiter. When we were all in the lobby waiting for a table, they were not wearing their masks. When they were done they walked out not wearing their masks. When 1 or 2 of them went to use the restroom they went right past our table, no mask. I am just trying to go to my favorite restaurant with my family  and feel safe, but that did not happen tonight.

Great location ! I love the happy hour specials. What i really like about this location is that you can tell it is a high volume restaurant but the wait is never long, the food quality is always amazing, and the staff is generally very nice professional and very knowledgeable! I&#39;d your in the neighborhood swing by. You won&#39;t be disappointed!!!!

Terrible customer service. As we got seated by the female up front about 10 minutes went by and a different female walked by and asked me and my wife if someone sat us here? She looked confused as if we weren&#39;t supposed to be taken to our table yet. Then Proceeded to ask us if a male or a female sat us there. At this point not only did this frustrate us but also made us feel I unwelcome there. About 15 more minutes go by and still no server shows up to greet us and take our drink order. furthermore making us feel like no one knew we were even there.  My wife gave it another 5 minutes before we would walk out to go elsewhere that we would be welcomed. Waiter finally shows up and takes our order.  While we waited for our order we had already received our drinks and bread and a different waiter comes to our table and starts talking to us as if she&#39;s going to be out waiter but we already had a waiter. She&#39;s confused and asks is if we had already been helped. We told her yes and then she looks confused as if we shouldn&#39;t have been helped yet. At this point we realize they have very terrible communication among the employees. Very terrible service and experience here. I am never coming to this location ever again. Me and my wife felt very unwanted here and the lack of communication cost us more time than it should have. Unacceptable for a high-end restaurant that I thought it was.
The burger was about the size of a Big Mac, but less appealing. Overcooked, tiny and dry. This is the worst food I have ever had at a Cheesecake Factory.

Horrible service. Don&#39;t waste your time as they are not equipped to serve curbside/to go orders. Complete chaos! <br><br>My Wife ordered curbside pickup..2 slices of cheesecake. I pulled in and waited for a text as instructed then called but no answer. I finally went in 15 min after my scheduled pickup and the employee could not find the order. <br><br>10 min later she found the order. The cheesecake was not dressed with any of the normal whip cream or topping, AND there was a hair in it!

My favorite cheesecake spot &#39;lemon lime&#39;. I would have given it five stars if not for the long wait in the cheesecake line. We were the 3rd people in that particular line and no one was attending to us about 15min. I finally sough a man who looked like the manager asked him what the deal was &#39;going to leave the rest here&#39;. The most important take away was when the manger came back and immediately attended to our need and offered a free slice.

Can&#39;t go wrong with this establishment. There&#39;s something for everyone with their diverse menu, and the food is always great. The Biltmore location is always fun to go to, and everyone I have interacted with has been friendly.

Worst Cheesecake Factory location I have ever been to. <br>The server had great manners, but he was overwhelmed with the amount of table he was serving at the same time. It took us almost 25 minutes to order food and another 30 to 40 minutes to get it. I was telling my wife, maybe the food is worth the wait.. well I was completely wrong...<br>1. Korean cauliflower- i ordered it before at the Scottsdale location, I know the portion size and know how it looks.  It was in a sea of oil at the bottom, that was disgusting.<br>2. Dynamite shrimp- the sauce was disgusting, looks like store bought chipotle ranch or something.<br>3. The calamari was ok - you&#39;d expect better from  a franchise like this. The batter was too salty.<br>Now let&#39;s go to the main course:<br>I ordered the fish and chips, that was the worst fisH and chips I have ever had. The size of fish were smaller than a walker shortbread cookie. It was completely bland, no trace of salt or pepper. I have had fish and chips before at the  Scottsdale location, that was so good, I decided to get it here too, but golly I was wrong this time.<br><br>Management please change chef, or close the restaurant down. Don&#39;t open a restaurant at the heart of Camelback and serve disgusting food like  this.

Service: is great at this location. The server we had took the time to explain all the menu items we had questions on. Even made recommendations, which were amazing!!<br>Wait: usually the wait time on the weekend is about 30-40 minutes. It&#39;s worth the wait. <br>Food: the quality of the food is great! Usually the portion size is equivalent to what you pay

Today was the worst experience I&#39;ve ever had at any  Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever been to across the country. My family and I frequent this location often but will no longer be patrons due to their discrimination against my infants stroller.  There was no wait and plenty of tables were open and available.<br><br>Aside from being told that they could not accommodate my child&#39;s stroller and could not seat my family AT ALL because of our stroller, I was then called a liar to my face by the hostess who deliberately lied to the manager when I called him over in saying that she didn&#39;t say we couldn&#39;t be seated when in fact she did. I was told &#34;we cannot seat you and the stroller&#34; by an eye-rolling, brunette hostess whose mid-drift was exposed (which I&#39;m sure is against company policy). <br><br>The general manager, Rick Fredrickson, defended his employee&#39;s lie without listening to my account of the situation. I explained to him that his employee needed to learn how to service the customer and find solutions instead of telling the customer &#34;no&#34; to something that was completely within her control and her only job...to find her paying customers a table so that I can contribute to her paycheck and ensure that she is able to continue to buy more too little shirts to wear to work when she denies paying customers a table to sit at.  <br><br>The manager and the hostesses at this location did not provide customer service on any level and we will not be back.

I M so disappointed with your &#34;lo carb&#34; cheesecake.  It is by no means lo carb, reduced carb maybe, but definitely not lo carb.  I have been buying them for years, as I am always on a lo carb diet.  I was told several years ago, that the carb count was 7net carbs.  Well last night while I was waiting for 2slices to go, I was informed that it actually has 42gms of carbs.   That is more than most people on a lo carb diet can have in 2 days total.  Never again!
I always love Cheesecake Factory! Megan was sweet and very friendly! Came for a little birthday date with a good friend of mine and it was quiet and delicious. This is always my go to spot!

Went there last sunday to celebrate my daughter  birthday.  Place was not busy. We were seated  promptly.  We received our water immediately  . The waiter  asked if we wanted  drinks but did not get our bread for about 15 minutes.  The bread was very good . Ordered and got our dinner  in 14 minutes.  We ordered  pineapple  upside down  cheese cake but it was not very good . The waitress was  pushing that flavor.  I should have stuck to what I know

I have been here many times for dinner, and just came here today for brunch.  The brunch menu was small and was limited to your traditional breakfast foods.  I would have liked to see a little more variety.  The waiter was younger and very prompt and professional.  I ordered the eggs benedict and my fellow dinner ordered an egg combo with a bagel.<br><br>Everything was tasty except the break.  With my eggs benedict, the english muffin was toasted to beyond the point where I could cut it with a knife.  The bagels were rock hard.  I was fine with not having the english muffins, but my friend spent 10 minutes to try and get another bagel.  In the end, we just gave up and enjoyed what was left of our food.  <br><br>Despite any shortcomings of breakfast, the cheesecake makes any meal better.

I work at the Biltmore and on occasion being home dinner after working. I gave Cheesecake a try since I had never ordered a pick up order and we love their cheesecake!! My husband ordered spaghetti with meatballs and I ordered the Chicken Madeira. And of course a slice of Oreo cheesecake!! The orders were very generous!! And delicious! My husband prefers his spaghetti sauce more saucy but the flavor was great! My chicken meal was delicious with yummy sauce. But, I forgot to get a photo!! The cheesecake of course was the Star!! Thanks Cheesecake Factory for helping a working Lady bring home the Bacon and Dinner!!

Terrible it took 45 minutes to get our food for a (table of 4). Had to get a manager only to find out the server didn&#39;t have the decency to tell us that there was a large party and it put everything behind. Manager didn&#39;t believe me until he went to kitchen to check for himself.insulting. !

Great service from FRANCISCO .   He was literally on it with multiple drink refills and anytime a server brings you a refill without asking if you want one deserves five stars<br><br>Had the flat bread pizza with pepperoni it was very tasty the salads are great you can never go wrong heresy
This is my go to place when I need to satisfy a variety of dietary preferences in my group. <br>I have had great service, and service that left more to be desired. But either way I&#39;ll be back!

Beyond disappointed. We went for dinner tonight. Was informed it was a 20min wait and asked us to wait outside in 100+ degree weather with my young children. There was a bench open in the lobby all alone so we sat. Across the lobby on another bench was a group of about 6 people hanging out. They were there when we walked in. About 2mins of waiting a manager approached us and told us we couldn&#39;t wait inside we had to go out; they informed the other group as well (which is weird as they had been there waiting with no issues). Manager said the bar is open you can all go over there but we can&#39;t have you sitting here. So you&#39;re telling me per social distancing dumb rules, with stupid masks we can&#39;t sit many many feet apart in the lobby but we can definitely go congregate at the bar where social distancing is more difficult. See ya later cheesecake your restaurant sucks anyway!

I hadn&#39;t been here in years but it was just as good as I remember it, only a little more expensive.<br><br>We met some friends here for dinner. Parking on a Friday night is a challenge but they have valet if you don&#39;t want to circle around. When we checked in we were told it would be around 15 minutes but they had us seated in about 5.<br><br>Their menu is huge. Honestly, it&#39;s too big but there is something for everyone which is nice. We started with the crispy Cuban egg rolls and the stuffed garlic bread which were both excellent, the dipping sauce for the egg rolls was delicious! There was a variety of dishes from Alfredo, salads, steak Diane, another pasta dish and my orange chicken on the table and everything looked good. My orange chicken had great flavor and I thoroughly enjoyed it. The serving size was huge so I had the rest for lunch the next day. We were all stuffed but but you can&#39;t leave without trying the cheesecake. We tried the salted Carmel and a couple of milkshakes for our younger dining counterparts.<br><br>The service was excellent and our servers were very friendly and helpful. <br><br>My dinner bill for 3 with an appetizer, sodas, 3 entrees, 1 piece of cheesecake and a milkshake was $93.00 before the tip.<br><br>The only downside of the dinner was the restrooms. Two of the three stalls had no toilet paper.

Oh yes, baby, yes! I would drive to any city just to have Cheesecake Factory. I really enjoyed my dinner last night. I had some exquisite food and awesome company. The bartender John was very professional and helpful.<br><br>The food was phenomenal. I had the Herb Crusted Salmon (although I personally wouldn&#39;t call it &#39;crusted&#39;) and the Steak Diane combo. It came with the famous mashed potatoes - which are a must no matter what you get. I came with my co workers for dinner and we all enjoyed our meals. The salmon was cooked perfectly and not dry whatsoever. The steak was a little tough for Medium-Rare but it had a pleasant and warming taste. <br><br>No matter who you are, there is something for everyone at CCF! I recommend going through the plethora of pictures or at the very least scan the menu before you visit the restaurant, otherwise you will find yourself reading a book of the menu. You can get any of the pastas and be full and then some. The portions are very generous and worth it!

I love having dinner at the Cheesecake Factory. My favorite dish is the Hibachi Steak, medium rare! So juicy. <br>I always attend the location in Chandler but this one is actually closer to home, so I thought why not.  First, the guy in front looked bothered when we asked if we could get a booth. Second, our waitress would miss our table when she was checking in on her other three tables. When asked for soy sauce, she brought a bottle that contained about one squirt of soy sauce left..I sensed we were getting treated differently. .<br>Definitely never experienced this in Chandler.

Love their happy hour menu. The Nachos are tasty and truly too big to eat alone so either bring a healthy appetite or grab a friend! The Chicken Potstickers are yummy yummy, sitting on that plate in a puddle of delicious soy-ginger sesame sauce. <br><br>A tip for the adventurous: pour the extra sauce from the Potstickers over the Nachos. It just works, I promise!

ROACHES!!!!!!!!!!<br>It started off as a normal evening... On 7/17/20 <br>My wife and I went to this location really looking forward to dining in. To our surprise, just shortly after the first appetizer arrived my wife pointed out the fact that she saw some bugs.. I was thinking it was maybe like a fly or a spider and I wasn&#39;t worried but my wife looked extremely nervous so I proceeded to look down on the side of the table.  To my surprise I saw the LARGEST COCKROACH I had ever seen in my entire existence!!! I mean it was ENORMOUS.. but me being the gentleman I am I didn&#39;t want to cause a scene so I called an employee over for some assistance. The employee seemed completely unbothered by the situation and proceeded to tell me &#34; Oh I&#39;ll get the manager&#34;. The manager arrived to the table shortly after he was summoned, with no apology the first thing he says to my wife and I is &#34;are you sure it&#39;s not just a beetle you saw? Are you guys from Arizona? Because we have beetles that swarm in around this time of year.&#34; I proceeded to explain to him that I was positive it was an enormous roach. He acted as if what I was telling him was fictitious. The manager then proceeded to move the plant next to the table and realized that I was indeed correct. It was a roach. He then squashed the roach in front of my wife and I and then walked off with no explanation. As he walked away he uttered &#34;sorry about that&#34; as if it was a normal occurrence. He seemed completely unbothered and unapologetic. I&#39;ve worked in the service industry before and this was by far the worst customer service I have ever experienced! Which came as a surprise since this establishment is supposed to be on the &#34;higher end&#34; of the low end restaurants. I don&#39;t even like writing these but I was livid. This was disgusting. It made me sick to my stomach. I&#39;ve never been treated so poorly in my life not even by a McDonald&#39;s employee. This was completely unacceptable! Save yourself the time, money, and potential food poisoning by dining elsewhere. I intend on contacting the health department to have them do an audit. Thank you for your time.

Happy hour time is the best time at the Cheesecake Factory!  I took pix of their HH menu for your eyes only  <br>I got their chicken rolls appetizer, my hubby got their chicken fried sliders with a side of fries.  Portions are gigantic! Flavors are a mouth full! I topped it with a Long island ice tea for just $5.95.  Our grand total was $21.  We also had a complimentary bread basket and butter with white and dark bread rolls.  Bon appetit!<br>Ambiance was chill, TV background, some people are on their laptops wrapping their day, pleasant staff, street view, high top tables mixed with low table lounges and couches.

The food tastes great, but while we were eating we felt it was pretty damn salty. We never eat at places like this....so we didn&#39;t think much of it. <br><br>We got home and both of us were &#34;high&#34; on MSG and were super tired. Within minutes we were both sick and the diarrhea lasted all night. <br><br>It is the next morning and we are both still feeling out of sorts with headaches from &#34;hell.&#34;<br>I&#39;m never eating at Cheesecake Factory again, as there are much healthier alternatives on the Camelback corridor. We hadn&#39;t been to CF in about 10 years, but were hungry for something different and wanted cheesecake. Last time. <br><br>BTW-the service was great...so no problem there....just can&#39;t and won&#39;t ever do MSG again at CF.

This location always has the best service. The staff is very nice as soon as you walk in. My server kept checking on me and making sure we were doing good. We didn&#39;t wait long for drinks from the bar or the delicious bread basket. Our food was cooked to perfection and the drinks were on point for the price. I will be returning again and again.
Food presentation: Great<br>Service: OK<br>Food: OK<br>Dessert: Fantastic... How can you go wrong with the name, Cheese Cake Factory.<br>Cleanliness: Poor...... even after I told hostess!

I know, I know, corporate food, but one thing is for sure, you know it&#39;ll be consistent at any of the restaurants. The menu  is very diverse, that&#39;s what we like. Prices are little on the high side, but the potions make up for it, on some dishes. <br>  We always never order the sandwiches or burgers, why pay over $10 for those items when you could easily go to you favorite buger joint or deli. <br>    Service and food is always consistent!

Received a gift card to the Cheesecake Factory for Christmas, and my husband I stopped in to use it while running errands in the area one afternoon.<br><br>I haven&#39;t eaten at a Cheesecake Factory in years, and it was about what I expected. Large variety with decent food and service.<br><br>My husband ordered two apps for his meal- chicken samosas and the fried Mac and cheese balls.<br><br>The chicken samosas were very good. I&#39;d return for those alone. The seasoning was very flavorful and the dipping sauce was delicious. The Mac and cheese balls were solid but could use more flavor in the Mac and cheese itself.<br><br>It was the tail end of brunch, and since I hadn&#39;t eaten breakfast, I ordered the chilaquiles. The were eggs over cooked and so was pork, but the sauce good.<br><br>The service was friendly but a little slow. My drink took quite a long time to come out, as did our food.<br><br>We were too stuffed to eat it there, but we did get a slice of classic cherry cheesecake to go. I ate it a few hours later, and it was perfect.<br><br>I&#39;m not rushing to go back to Cheesecake Factory, but next time, I&#39;d stick to apps and cheesecake.

So normally I wouldn&#39;t write a review for Cheesecake Factory, well because it is Cheesecake Factory and it is alway just ordinary and mostly mediocre. But after our experience this time I had to write one. This review is all about our server Charles. We usually only go to Cheesecake Factory for the happy hour food because it is decent size portions for a reasonable price. Going for happy hour means we always it at a table in the bar. We did the same thing this time but man was the experience different. We were greeted right away and waters hit the table without even asking. Charles was so happy and friendly. You could tell all he wanted was for us to have a great time, and great time we had. He was so on top of our drinks I could have floated out of there. Really, my drink (no -alcoholic) never got past 1/2 full. If it got close, there was Charles taking it away to refill it. But it wasn&#39;t only the drinks.... he was so on top of the food order, condiments, napkins.... ETC. He was everywhere! I mean it was happy hour in the bar. He had so many tables and it was amazing how he gave each and everyone the same attention and great service. He literally was like a high energy ping pong ball all over the bar. This was by far the best service we have ever received from Cheesecake Factory and we can&#39;t wait to go again but will call and make sure Charles is working first.

Went to The Cheesecake Factory with my family expecting a hearty meal for a dinner before Christmas. In the moment, the Chicken Madeira I ordered was extremely tasty alongside a great pile of delicious mashed potatoes. Afterwards, we enjoyed a slice of the Coffee Cream Chocolate Supreme cheesecake, which was very tasty as well. All of the staff we interacted with were nice and provided great customer service. Unfortunately, this is where this story takes a turn.<br><br>At about 3 am the next morning, I developed a horrible bout of food poisoning, leading me to vomit profusely multiple times. Looking back, I have no doubt that the chicken in the Chicken Madeira dish was undercooked, giving me this horrible illness. Looking back on the meal, the chicken did look a tad off unlike most chicken that is cooked correctly.<br><br>I will never return to this location nor any other Cheesecake Factory location due to this incident. This has simply ruined the experience for me. I hope others can read this and think twice before ordering a chicken dish at The Cheesecake Factory.

I had two completely different experiences eating here twice. The first time I came to eat here my waiter was Charles. Charles was the BEST server I&#39;ve ever had. He checked on us frequently, had great recommendations, and shared a couple of jokes. I had a crusted chicken Romano and it was amazing. Overall the food and the experience was amazing.<br><br>The second time I came to eat here Mandy was our server. She seemed nice at first but kept pressuring us to order. She had a very quiet voice and would become upset when we would ask her to repeat herself. I tried to ask about and item on the menu but she was very rude about it. I asked her what &#34;white chicken chili&#34; was and she said &#34;what have you never seen chili before. It&#39;s the same thing. Do you know what chicken is? Are you gonna order it or what?&#34; I decided to just order it because she kept making us feel uncomfortable and when she brought the food it looked and tasted like canned dog food... after a couple of bites, I set the plate aside which she had no problem picking it up and charging it instead of asking how it was or if I even liked it. Overall it was a very uncomfortable experience and as great as Charles is, we will no longer be coming back to this location. Very upsetting and unprofessional.

Stop in after running errands. Sat at the bar area, first time. Bartender name was: Ariel. Even though she was busy we had a chance to have a great conversations. She is a sweetheart! Hope to have her again serve me :)
As an adult I&#39;ve been here many times. Brought my kids for the first time and they had a great experience.

The food was awesome here. I ordered the bamg bang chicken and it was delightful. However, i didnt like the interaction at the beginning. I dont like how customer service is here but everything else was good.
It was yummy.  I had spegitty with meat balls.  I loved it.  I am here with  Miguel Villuava.  This is my 3rd time here.  The service today was good for me.  Try it.  You might like it.

Always a good meal here with such an expansive menu.<br><br>Love the bread at the beginning, warm Sourdough or a brown bread.<br><br>Ordered many meals here and would recommend the Miso Glazed Salmon, Shrimp over Angel Hair Pasta, Orange  Chicken, Chicken Marsala with Mushrooms and their Build Your Own Omelette.<br><br>Then save room for the cheesecake of course, depending on your taste you can&#39;t be beat here. I go for the old school Strawberry Cheesecake, Oreo Dream Extreme Cheesecake, Kahlua Cocoa Coffee Cheesecake.<br><br>Prices are in the $12 - $20 range with good quality and huge portions.<br><br>Service is always top notch.<br><br>Even though this is a chain, it is always a go to restaurant and open late for the late night eaters.

I thought I had already written reviews for both of the Cheesecake Factory locations we frequent the most.<br>Not very pleased lately, one of our most recent visits to this one I had a steak with a side of broccoli, sans the broccoli. My server never brought my side even after we brought it to her attention. <br>And they did not even give us a discount or comp... <br>We liked them very much in the past but we have not had the best experiences recently, both at Biltmore and North Scottsdale.

Stayed across the street for a staycation, and decided to try out Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;m not much for chain restaurants however, Cheesecake Factory delivered. I was very impressed with the quality and portions of our meals, and amazed by how good their cheesecake was. I had the 3 cheese pasta, it was slap your mama, grandma put her foot in it good. The wife had the flat bread pizza, and she too was amazed by how delicious it was. She had the lemon cheesecake, and I had the lemon raspberry cheesecake... they were so good. We are going back this Saturday.
We like the menu variety I had the Turkey avocado club yum wife enjoyed the beautiful Pork chop and the cheese cake which one to choose tuff call
Great place to eat if you get there on off hours. No military or senior discounts offered. Great cheesecake desserts. Huge selection. Good and friendly service.

The service was subpar and the food was ok. I&#39;m used to getting my food when it&#39;s still hot but this meal was room temperature when I received my plate. The chef did their part because the food was seasoned properly. I guess the young man left our food in the kitchen while he assisted others because we barely saw him and when we did it was quick and lacking. Very disappointed with this trip to the Cheesecake Factory at the Biltmore.

I am judging this from a HUGE CHAIN perspective, to be fair. The winner here at our meal was the fresh baked bread which seemed right out of Jersey City...the bread brought me back home. I have to think hard about the rest of our meal. I had the Asian chicken, kind of a brown sauce with lots of spice. It was okay. The salad was good. I can see why people like this place, it is large and can accommodate a million families and the dessert menu and case at the exit are quite alluring. I guess I would bring an older friend or parent here. I like better food....

My wife and I go here yearly for our birthdays and have the same thing every time my favorite is the bacon bacon burger and she has lettuce wraps overall the quality and the atmosphere is great when you order a burger medium it comes out medium not over cooked not raw in the middle perfect thank you Cheesecake Factory serve for supplying the food for my birthday

Who doesn&#39;t love The Cheescake Factory, it&#39;s such a classic! However the bakery services is super slow! I placed an online order @ 7:10 arrived to the resturant @ 7:40. I literally didn&#39;t get my cheesecake until 8pm. Smh. I think they need two registers in that section, it&#39;s the worst.

If I could give the Cheesecake Factory 0 stars I would. Talking about the Cheesecake Factory bothers me so much that writing this review is going to be rough. The atmosphere in the Cheesecake Factory is disgusting. The fake &#34;broken down walls&#34; are weird and disturbing. The dish sizes are unnecessary and overpriced for the quality. The bathrooms smell like old women and prosti******. Whoever is on aux has no clue what people want to listen to while eating large portions of thick, lumpy alfredo. Walking past the Cheesecake Factory will sometimes cause my gag reflex to be abruptly triggered. After writing this review I am sad. So so so sad that there is a restaurant like this that people go to for weird prom dinners. The Cheesecake Factory is a place for broken families.

The 1st time my girlfriend and I came and visit we had a good time. Busy but still kept up to speed and at the end of day there wasn&#39;t really any problem. But today was a whole new story. We get there at around 6:55 and in the beginning it was the same old story (waiting time, get our seat and then select our drinks) but that&#39;s where it went wrong. We hardly ever saw our server and had to wait 20 minutes for our drinks. Another 30 minutes go by and still nothing other then us along asking another server where our food was. We waited too long and basically just cancelled our order. We still were charged our drinks and had to have the manager to finish the bill. No eye contact or apology from the manager as he just sent the server back our receipt. Seriously had high hopes for this place but ended being the one and only restaurant I had to walk out on.

I&#39;m not even going to write a full review cause the food sucked and I don&#39;t think there&#39;s any coming back from it,my avocado egg rolls were soggy. My salmon was dry and I had to order a second martini to be able to eat my food.  I would never go back unless it was just for cheesecake

Husband and I came here for&#34;happy hour&#34;. He ordered a Manhattan that took 30 minutes and was done wrong. God forbid someone in Chattanooga actually wants a cocktail and not beer. Ordered nachos with chicken. They arrived, I said to the server, &#34;I don&#39;t see chicken&#34;. She said, &#34;It&#39;s underneath&#34;. It was not. Talked to the manager. He said, &#34;The ticket doesn&#39;t say chicken&#34;. This was NOT a happy hour. I won&#39;t return. <br>Moved from CA where Cheesecake Factory was known for quality and consistency. This one is neither.

Came here for my birthday and it did the trick. I had the passion fruit mojito and Verde lasagna. OMG.. both so wonderful. <br><br>I knew the mojito wouldn&#39;t dissapoint, and the Verde lasagna was out of this world!!! Five stars for both! The mushroom marinara was so hearty and made everything even that much more delicious. <br><br>Since it was my birthday, they brought me a cute little sundae with a lit candle and they sang to me. A perfect outing.

Waiter named Justin R. was a bit underenergetic and gave some attitude the manager kept on staring at us for some unknown reason, but other than that our waiter Justin kept the refills coming left and right. It was my first time trying The cheesecake factory and with this bad experience for my first time makes me believe I will never go to this location ever again.

Well, we were all very hungry and we picked Cheesecake factory as it was 1 pm and the crowd was mostly gone.  <br><br>We got seated promptly, however, our waitress seemed like she was rushing at every pass.  Ordering our drinks, our food, it was like sit down and tell her immediately what we want.  There was no warmth there at any level.  Very poor service.  We felt very uncomfortable.<br><br>Needless to say, we ordered our salads and we ordered Ranch and got Vinagarette!  How does that happen?  RUSHING!!!!  We had to get them replaced twice.<br><br>We ordered our entree&#39;s along with an appetizer.  So, I don&#39;t know what the Brea Ca location is doing right, but the other locations need to follow it.  The QA at this facility was atrocious. We tried the Fried zucchini once again and once again, let down.  There was zero, zip, nada flavor at all.  In Brea, they had awesome seasoning and were cooked perfectly.  Here it was dumped and served.  Just terrible. <br><br>I ordered the Eggplant Parmasean for my Entree.  We waited about 20 minutes only for the waitress to come back and say they were out.  How can you be out of Eggplant at lunch at 1 pm???  Again, lack of rigor and discipline in the kitchen as you should never run out of anything especially a top seller.<br><br>So I had to find something else and ordered the Truffle Honey Chicken.  What a disappointment.  Two small pieces of this so called chicken were as hard as a rock.  You had a very hard time cutting it with the sharpest knife and it was un-edible as it was too hard to chew.  It was like eating rocks.<br><br>The Gumbo was ok, but slopped in the bowl and lacked any presentation as well as the orange chicken.<br><br>We tried to end on a good note with a piece of their new Celebration Cheesecake.  Well, unless you like Icing and I mean a lot of icing this is for you.  However, if you like a cake along with your icing this is not for you.  This was layer and layer of icing on a very, very small sliver of cake.  What a waste.  This one needs to be shelved.<br><br>Needless to say, Cheesecake Factory lacks QA across the board and the food gets wasted as it cannot be eaten.  Very frustrated on this visit.

Save some room in your stomach for those guilty pleasures, this is The Cheesecake Factory after all.They have an insane variety of cheesecakes.The Red velvet, Fresh strawberry and the original are my favorites.<br>However, if you are not into Cheesecakes they also have some mean ice cream sundaes and   cakes.The Black out cake is so Gooey(must have if your a chocoholic).<br>I generally end up eating just appetizers and desserts because the dessert portions are really huge and can be shared by two (or Not).<br><br>They have a pretty extensive menu with a good variety of cocktails,Beer,Wine,Milkshakes etc.<br>I tried the Peach Bellini which is a blend of Champagne,peaches and peach Liqueur.It was quite refreshing and tasted more like a peach smoothie nothing too strong.We also had some stuffed Mushrooms and Crispy fried Cheese.<br><br>The booths are cozy with dim lights,service was fast and friendly.This Location definitely scores higher than the others.<br><br>Cheers!

The Korean Fried Cauliflower was AMAZING, the sauce really made the dish, the wedge of lime offered a fresh zest. The mac and cheese balls came in at a close second. Everything was great but we all got dessert to go and when home realized one was missing, after calling the store were informed we were never charged for it. Had to go back and repurchase or disappoint the person who we were celebrating.

My whole experience here was awesome. First off our waiter Nick was on top of it and so nice, he knew what was up with the bread re-fills too holla. Started off with fried macaroni, solid app right there. And of course bread which was served warm and I asked for olive oil and red wine vinegar on the side. Four cheese pasta as main course. It was the BOMB. Creamy carb deliciousness y&#39;all. I took a piece of chocolate mousse cheesecake home and SO glad I did, no regrets.

I&#39;ve never hated anything I&#39;ve gotten here. I enjoy the variety of options, I mean, the menu is a small book. My mom got the wellness salad and loved it. I got the skinny girl Asian chicken salad (but with the plum dressing, cause let&#39;s be real) and my brother got the club sandwich. It&#39;s always a nice atmosphere and good food... can&#39;t complain.

Cheesecake Factory has to be one of the best &#34;staple&#34; go to places in the US.  No matter what state you are in you know you can go here and have a great meal.<br><br>I have been going to Cheesecake for years as it is right down the street from my work and we pop in to have lunch at the bar.  I don&#39;t know if i&#39;ve ever had anything bad from this place before.  their portions are always great for leftovers and the service is never bad in my experience.  <br><br>You honestly can&#39;t go wrong with this place as they have almost every type of cuisine you can think of.  Oh ya I also hear they have something called cheesecake.  They might have a couple of different kinds for you to try if you&#39;re into something that tastes like heaven mixed with cream cheese and sugar.  <br><br>No matter what city you&#39;re in you can always feel at home at a Cheesecake Factory.

This was my first time to The Cheesecake Factory and I am so disappointed with my experience.  I had such a rude server that did not attend to my table at all. We waited 45 minutes for three appetizers and when the food fInally came out, It was wrong. The server offered the wrong appetizer that was brought out but did not apologize once for the mistake. Our waters were not refilled at all and we attempted to get our servers attention multiple times but were completely ignored. This was truly such a terrible  experience. I will not be back.
Enjoyed the quick seating tonight, usually a 45 minuets! Good food and service <br>Cheesecake definitely the best

The Cheesecake Factory off 24th St &amp; Camelback is definitely the best location. Behind the Bar M-F is the inviting Bartender John. I can tell you that my choice to sit at the bar every time I come in is because of this guy. All you regulars in the Biltmore area know what I am talking about. This guy is great and really makes this location the best. I kept my dining experience simple this time with the Sweet Corn Tamale Cakes. Let me tell you these things are great! I also ordered the Chocolate Tower Truffle Cake. This piece of cake is better than any cheesecake on the menu. If you find yourself in the area check it out.

My daughter and her roommate and I had the exquisite pleasure of meeting Monica C. As our waitress today. July 15, 2018 11:10am <br>I came to visit my daughter from San Diego, CA.  <br>she just got her first place after graduating from ASU in May 2018. <br>With all of our choices of restaurants we decided on Cheesecake Factory. Are we ever glad we did .....<br>Our meals were delicious Nacho&#39;s, Bread and Butter, Pasta, Kale Salad, Eggs Benedict&#39;s and special coffee drinks. <br>Monica was so efficient, pleasant and fun to have as our waitress. <br>We will definitely be back because of the Service and our wonderful meals. <br>You are fortunate to have Monica on your team. <br>Thanks for a great experience.  <br>We will tell our family and friends about our wonderful experience.  <br>Carol Lovejoy<br>619 316-8431
I normally frequent this location and am normally never let down! Typically always receive great service and the food always has come out great. The manager Doug make it even better!

Underwhelmed went here on Saturday for lunch for four we were seated quickly then the server kind of tossed the drink napkins in our table instead of setting them down he seemed annoyed that my niece was not ordering her drink right away and made a hurry up gesture we were sat near the kitchen and the banging plates and silverware clanging was annoying and distracting the food was good and hot however I don&#39;t know if we would go back I wanted to go to this location because of the greatest location and service didn&#39;t work for me this time

The Cheesecake Factory hardly disappoints, with their huge menu offering just about anything for the variety of palates. <br><br>I had the skinny-luscious steak medallions and they were tasty but surely small. Of course I knew I was ordering off the skinny-Lucius menu but it was quite a surprise to see how small they were. I made the mistake of ordering them medium - since they&#39;re so small they came back cooked pretty medium well (my bad). <br><br>The cucumber lemonade is where it&#39;s at! They muddle fresh lime in it and it&#39;s absolutely delicious!!! Our server Marcella couldn&#39;t hear us though. And she brought chocolate milk out for my kid even though I distinctly said white. She tried, however- it seemed.

The slowest Togo you can ever order from. I&#39;ve waited 40 minutes past the ready time for my food, other times 10 to 15 minutes past the time they told me to be ready. Clearly they are not staffed properly. Even when I order delivery through Doordash they are always late. Management get it together!
Always liked this place. The wait staff is friendly and the food is good. The setup of the place is very nice and clean.
The wait time for food takeout is CONSISTENTLY 25-30 minutes longer than their estimates. Way to waste my time!!<br><br>No other place does this as badly as the Cheesecake Factory at this location.

My family and I love Cheesecake Factory, we do have a location closer to us that we go to from time to time, but this Saturday we were in this side of town and decided to come to the location on 24th Street and Camelback. From the minute we got there the service was spectacular! The hostess (I didnt catch her name, but its a lady with dread locks) was so darn nice! We got a highchair for our baby, she cleaned the entire chair for us, carried the baby, and assisted me to get my squirmy baby in the chair! I mean... who does that?? She acknowledged my whole family! My 7 year old is a chatter box and she listened to her whole story about her dance recital she had just had that day! <br>Our Waiter was Kyle, very, very nice young man! My Parents speak no English and we often get looks and huffs and puffs from Waiters when we have to speak Spanish, but that was definitely not the case! Kyle took care of us, he was very attentive and extremely patient with us all! We&#39;ve never had better service! We will most definitely be visiting this location more often, your customer service makes the drive worth it! Keep up the great work!

I&#39;m writing this as I am sitting here. If I could give this place zero stars I would. Our waiter is horrible. He only has 3 tables to tend to and he seems to only give more attention to them. We waited 10 minutes before he took our order. Asked for a refill, which took another 10 minutes. But the tables next to us seemed to get their. No way am I leaving tip. Not once has he come to check on us. I have been to better locations.
Very good..the food was made to perfection. The vibe is chill and the margaritas are to die for.

I would have to give this place 1 star! It was my first time at this location and I will never go back! Took 30 min to seat us! The waiter was not tending to our table and when he did it was like he was in a hurry! There was a hair on the table! This place was a mess there was food and silverware under every table I looked at! My pasta noodles were all clumped together! Did not look right at all!  When I sent it back the manager came to the table and did not apologize. And just told us we could leave. Nothing but POOR SERVICE

The Philly cheesesteak bread is real tough.  It was very hard to eat.  In fact, I could not eat more than four bites and when I mentioned this to the server, she really didn&#39;t care.   They do have a good kids meal selection, and the cheesecake was good, of course.  <br>The bathroom was very messy.  Paper towels were everywhere.  <br>Also, my son got a kids meal but was charged $3 for his drink.  When she asked what size for him, I wish I was told the drink with the kids meal was free and the bigger was $3.  <br>Be careful when you leave because there is a column by the door with a square bottom. I hit my knee on the corner and was lucky it didn&#39;t break the skin because it was chipped.

We love going to this Cheesecake Factory when in the mood for something a little different. The  ambience of the  restaurant is not as wonderful as some of the other restaurants,  but every time we go the food has been extremely good. We also have had the pleasure of great waiters when we go here, so that also gives this  restaurant a nice touch. I totally recommend coming here for  superior  food and awesome  staff.
Omg this 4 cheese pasta is amazing!!!!! For brunch, definitely order the cinnamon roll  pancakes!

I give a lot of chain restaurants 5 stars and I often reflect on whether they are deserved. This place does deserve it. Every Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever been to just has overall great atmosphere, great service, great food, and Great Dessert! This one is no different. I met some friends here for dessert and we all enjoy delicious cheesecake. I had the chocolate truffle cake and it really was amazing! I don&#39;t think I could have found a better one that night. The parking was a little bit confusing but apparently you can park in a private lot and get them to validate it. That would be good to know for next time.
I love Cheesecake Factory Reminds me of back home. I always sit at the bar. Great service, great food. Dope place to come for lunch.

Bartenders are great - whatever you order is delicious and if it&#39;s off, the manager rectifies it.  CF is a goto for whatever you&#39;re in the mood for - most meals can be split, or you&#39;ve got lunch for the next day.

Love this location, WILL NOT use Postmates for food delivery from CF. Our desserts mysteriously disappeared. Not the CF fault but they need not to partner with Postmates. Our 2nd time and items were missing.

I know it&#39;s a chain, and it&#39;s not &#34;cool&#34; to review chains, but whatever, we had a good experience, so I&#39;m going to let people thinking about eating there know... :P <br><br>We experienced the Cheesecake Factory&#39;s Happy Hour, and ooooh what a happy hour it is. Probably the best happy hour I&#39;ve encountered in a very long while. Everything that&#39;s normally well over $12 is $5, so we went crazy and ordered a plethora of things, and they were all good. Plus, with the look of the place, you really feel like you&#39;re doing some fine dining. Oh, and our server took good care of us. We&#39;ll return.

Not usually a big fan of chain restaurants, but I was in town with a friend visiting her dad, who wanted to take us here for lunch... free lunch, so who am I to argue. <br><br>Much nicer ambiance &amp; decor than most chain restaurants &amp; a lot of menu selections, so pretty hard to not find something you&#39;ll like. After hemming &amp; hawing about what to order, I finally settled on the California Cheese steak sandwich (minus the mushrooms... hate mushrooms), which was freakin&#39; delicious! So few good cheese steak places in San Diego &amp; I had to come to a chain for an amazing one. So many cheese steaks are either bland or so overloaded that you don&#39;t really taste any distinct flavor... just a big mash up of food overstuffed in a roll that all spills out as you try to eat it. The sandwich tasted just as good as the menu picture looked... hot juicy flavorful grilled steak, with ooey gooey melted cheese, along with onions &amp; peppers. The cheese perfectly molded everything together so nothing falls out as you eat it. What makes the sandwich so good is all the ingredients compliment each other, but the grilled steak flavor was still dominant over the cheese, onions &amp; peppers. The fries were pretty good, but weren&#39;t quite hot enough... I could tell the fries would&#39;ve been a lot better if they&#39;d been hot.<br><br>My friend had eaten too much meat on this trip already, so she opted for the Cobb salad &amp; loved it! She gave me a bite &amp; it was definitely one of the better Cobb salads I&#39;ve had before. Her dad ordered a burger, which he said was really good, but he got jealous when my sandwich arrived... he didn&#39;t see it on the menu.<br><br>Zaida was our server &amp; what an awesome server she is! Very friendly, personable &amp; an adorable smile. Checked in on us enough so we didn&#39;t really have to wait for a refill on anything. Service can make or break a restaurant... I mean who wants to go to a good restaurant where the servers are either not very friendly, or just going thru the motions, but Zaida was excellent at making us feel welcome.<br><br>Just the regular old cheesecake was amazing too, but I wish they didn&#39;t have to put the calories on display right in your face. Felt a little guilty at eating a 1200 calorie piece of cheesecake, but we were on vacation, so there ya go.

The Cheesecake Factory was a huge disappointment. I really believe that they should not sell food. Cheesecake? Yes. Food? No. First of all they are overpriced. Paying more than 17 dollars for an inedible fish and chips felt like I was being robbed. The appetizers were mediocre but at least edible. The Cuban sandwich tasted OK, however I would just call it a simple ham and cheese sandwich. And honestly why would I want to pay 15 dollars for that? Their signature  brown bread was delicious and our server Sydney saved the day with her professionalism and efficiency. Actually she earned all the stars. And no, we won&#39;t go back.

I was there two nights in a row with big groups while I was at a volleyball tournament for my daughter&#39;s team.  First of all, I really appreciated how servers offered to split the checks rather than us, the customers, having to ask.  The first night, I had the pasta napoletano which I would translate to a meat lover&#39;s pasta.  It was delicious and I never would&#39;ve thought I&#39;d ever eat pepperoni with pasta before.  I also had a drink called an Irish Manhattan because I was craving alcohol and coffee at the same time.  Let me say that there was plenty of alcohol, but not a lot of coffee to it unless you count the three coffee beans that sat in my martini glass.  It was nice, but not necessarily what I was looking for.  I had my regular raspberry white chocolate cheesecake. <br><br>The next night I went &#34;light&#34; with the egg roll sampler and the pork belly sliders.  I could not finish my food as it was plentiful.  The pork belly sliders had more of a pulled pork texture to it, so it kind of tricked my mind into thinking I was eating something else.  My daughter had the &#34;meat lovers&#34; pasta upon my recommendation and she loved it too.  Like father, like daughter I guess.  BTW, she hates pepperoni, but she gladly ate everything on her plate.  I ordered the banana creme cheesecake to go, while she ordered the Oreo Cookie Dream cheesecake.  Mine was okay, as I needed a stronger banana taste to satisfy my cravings.  My daughter thought her cheesecake was way too rich and so she barely touched hers when she tried it later.<br><br>All in all, you can&#39;t go wrong with this place.  Both nights the wait staff was kind, courteous, and patient with my large group.  I can imagine that large groups can be a nightmare for food servers, but they have this down pat.
So an updated I&#39;ve talked to 2 managers after this situation. they were very understanding and helpful. And the issue has been resolved.
Totally a fan of cheesecake factory.<br>Wasn&#39;t busy and we got $7 valet anyways.<br>They validate if you self park.<br>Only downside: my bench seat is in need of repairs
