It&#39;s like any other Cheesecake Factory out there, though with all the common problems I have with TCF this one stood out because of our great server, Brittaney.<br><br>The bread served was good, I&#39;m always a fan of sourdough but they were hardly warm.<br><br>For apps, I had the Tuna Tartare which was good, strong in flavor but the portion was way too small for something to cost $7. It came with barely enough fried off wontons to eat with the tartare.<br><br>I split the Louisiana Chicken pasta and even so the portion was filling. Good pasta with a kick to eat, creamy sauce and perfectly fried chicken. <br><br>For dessert I went with something light, so I decided on the Fresh Banana Cream Cheesecake. It was a bit too warm for my liking as I like my cheesecakes cold. The flavor was light and not too sweet though.<br><br>Our server Brittaney was so nice and gave great suggestions! A great waitstaff here overall. I suppose it&#39;s just the food here that can be a hit or miss and the price point is way more than what it should be.

Stopped at Biltmore Cheesecake Factory on my way home from Mesa to Surprise.  I ordered from the take out, Chicken Maderia without mushrooms, still want the sauce just no mushrooms because I don&#39;t like the texture of mushrooms.<br>I knew by the time i got home I was going to reheat it.<br>I opened it and sadly saw the best part missing the sauce!<br>Bummed I reheated it for 20 minutes.  The potatoes were still not cook at all!  They were hard as a rock.  Tried cooking it longer and just pitched the potatoes.  Then took a bite of the chicken and it was undercooked!  <br>So overall it sucked!

Chicken Waffle Benedict<br>Waited over 20 minutes for the order<br><br>The poached eggs were hard boiled<br><br>The hollandaise was a little curdled, what little was there - apparently the cook must be doling it out with a teaspoon<br><br>The waffle was cold but at least the chicken strips were hot<br><br>The home fries were inedible little square rocks which looked like they have been in the deep frier at least three times<br><br>Guy who brought it out pretty much just tossed in front of me and ran. <br><br>No syrup for the waffle.  No wait staff around until someone else sat down. <br><br>When I mentioned the issues it was &#34;do you want to speak to the manager&#34; which came out like code for go no to the Principals office. <br><br>Never been to a Chesecake Factory like this one.  Bizarre

Yeah, I&#39;m a fan. Tiffany our dinner server was excellent. Professionally &amp; personally working within the industry its challenging to restaurant and, certainly not hesitant to politely draw the horn. From beginning to end it was very simple &amp; very pleasing.Thou not sure why management has the dinner lights dimmed so low.

The Factory is winning with its appetizers. They aren&#39;t cheap, but from small plates to small salads, I don&#39;t remember having an app I didn&#39;t like. <br><br>On my latest visit, I dared to try the fried Mac and Cheese balls. I kept wavering at first, because I couldn&#39;t imagine their mac and cheese tasting any different than a box of pre-packaged stuff lurking in my pantry. But whoa! The dish knocked my socks off. Can I get an AMEN for comfort?<br><br>The nicely fried balls were close to 2.5 inches round with large noodles mixed with creamy cheesy goodness. I don&#39;t know what blend of cheese is used, but I was happy that I couldn&#39;t taste american cheese. And it wasn&#39;t as greasy as you would think. The mac balls are topped with a tomato-cheese dip that also taste pretty good. Four balls cost $11.95<br><br>Avocado Egg Rolls (11.95) speak for themselves and the accompanying dip speaks for everything else: <br>Six half rolls per dish are served on top of some useless white crunchy sticks that I ignore every time. I forgot to ask if I could substitute lettuce for them. At least then the egg rolls would be sitting on top of something pretty. Oh well, maybe I can save packing costs by using the sticks as padding for the next package I send for X-mas.<br><br>Sweet Corn Tamale Cakes (10.95):<br>I&#39;ve ordered this before and wanted to try a second time. Yes, it&#39;s a comforting dish. Sweet corn kernels are baked into three tamale pancakes and covered in garnish of avocado, pico, cream, and some kind of relish (which I just realized today) tastes very similar to Thousand Island.<br><br>Would I go to the Factory without ordering cheesecake? No, no I wouldn&#39;t. Ever since I had a good run with the Struessel (which they no longer carry unfortunately) I&#39;ve been tasting other flavors. This time I decided on the Lemon/Raspberry, dulce de leche, and white choco/raspberry. Hmmm, I like all three.

I love this place! It&#39;s perfect for a celebratory dinner or lunch when you want something a little fancier than your standard restaurant fare. I had The Club sandwich while my mom had the Wellness Salad. The food arrived promptly and was hot, even during the dinner rush. My sandwich was delicious to the last bite and of course, I saved room for cheesecake! The Oreo Dream Extreme cheesecake was the perfect finish to the meal. Excellent!

Came here to eat with friends for my 21st birthday on July 2nd around 9pm, and the service wasn&#39;t that great. I understand we came around the time they were closing (they had an entire hour before close) but you still have to treat your customers with the same amount of respect that your previous customers had received. Two of us paid with our card, and the other two paid with cash, and the server didn&#39;t give them their change back. The change was about $1 and some change for the both of them, so he ended up keeping close to $3 without ever putting it on the table. My friends most likely would&#39;ve given him that as a tip and then a little bit more, but no. He didn&#39;t even give them the chance to figure out how much they wanted to leave as a tip, he just never gave them the money back. So for that, I decided not to tip him, since he already decided on his own what his tip should have been. I don&#39;t want to sound like I&#39;m trying to make things all about me, but I went there on my birthday to eat with friends and the guy after checking my ID didn&#39;t even say happy birthday. The service just wasn&#39;t there. Also, in case you&#39;re going there for your birthday expecting a free slice of cheesecake, I guess they don&#39;t do that anymore. They now give you a sundae in the smallest cup. I tried to let my food cool off once it got to me, but the flatbread pizza slid around a lot, and I ended up eating only cheese and dough due to everything falling off.

Boy, I went for lunch and had about my worst restaurant experience ever!!!<br>I&#39;ve been in the biz in the past and go out of my way to be friendly as well as a solid 20 to 25 percent tipper. <br><br>I won&#39;t go into all the details,but took 30 min to get my burger. Afterwards asked for mustard. That took another 10 minutes.<br><br>Sitting at the bar I mentioned to the bartender that it seemed a long time to wait.. he got angry with me and started accusing my of treating him like a servant. <br>Which in fact employees of a restaurant are servants by definition..<br>It was so disturbing I paid, left no tip and more than half my food.<br>The manager was at the hostess station and I informed him of the treatment from the bartender. He seem not concerned..<br>I will never step foot in the restaurant again and will share my experience with many...<br>Bad bartender bad management...

(Part 1 of 2) <br>  I am writing this lengthy review to let everyone know that there are those who accommodate (within reason of course) and those who hate their jobs and simply don&#39;t give a BIT (you&#39;re already aware of what I truly wanted to type). <br><br>  I am immensely dissatisfied with my experience at this location (Biltmore | Phoenix). I initially dined at the bar and there was a man named John who provided terrible service. His critical thinking skills are beyond subpar and he is a terrible liar. When I first sat down he seemed rather attentive acting with urgency to make certain the counter space in front of me was clean and thoroughly wiped down (that was nice). I ordered some sourdough bread and he asked if I&#39;d cared for anything else at the moment. I told him that I wasn&#39;t feeling well, but would like to order something for carry-out in a few moments. It all went downhill thereafter. <br><br>  Firstly, all of the utensils provided to me were dirty (I should have taken photos). In all honesty, I get it considering I too have worked in the culinary field so sometimes it happens. But what truly bothered me was the fact that even several moments after my mashed potatoes arrived John hadn&#39;t noticed I set all of the dirty utensils far in front me on a dirty side plate along with a balled-up (clearly already utilized) bed napkin (you can check the video footage to confirm). I finally gave up and asked for a another fork, to which he did retrieve, however he did so in the middle of washing a glass and handed me the fork while his hand was dripping wet (ewww). AND he still didn&#39;t remove any of the dirty utensils which were placed in front of me--even after I succinctly told him they were dirty. <br><br>  Again, I was not feeling well and by this point I just wanted to enjoy my mashed potatoes before they got any colder. A few minutes later I was ready to place my To-Go order. I ordered Fried Macaroni Balls for my younger sister and a small side of steamed vegetables with marinara sauce for myself. John asked me how much of a portion I would like and I re-emphasized just a small order of steamed vegetables with only enough sauce to mix them with--NOT a hefty side. Several minutes later I was given a box of reddish-orange sauce which was freezing cold and (what I thought) was my side of steamed vegetables with marinara sauce and no macaroni balls. He (John) had no idea of what the sauce was as he attempted to tell me it was the marinara sauce for my vegetables (this was the first attempted lie). I informed him that I did not need an entire container of marinara sauce; only enough to make my requested vegetables. Just then, it dawned upon John that the cold sauce was for the macaroni balls and he immediately sprung to the kitchen to make certain that they were almost ready. Upon his return, (terribly confused) I informed him that the sauce was freezing cold to which he replied &#34;Oh, you plan on eating it now? They probably thought you were going to eat it later which is why they didn&#39;t heat it up.&#34; (This was his second attempt at a lie.) Surprisingly, he then took the box and went to heat it up. By this point I was entirely fed up, but I didn&#39;t see the point in discussing anything further with John considering how oblivious he was. He brought the remainder of my items and a bag on the side. I bagged up my own items and closed out my tab. I even tipped John--STILL (I know... I know... I&#39;m far too nice).

I have been to a Cheesecake Factory in Dallas but I have never gotten a pizza there . I have to say it was very good and cheesy . The cheesecake had a Nutella drizzle and a hazelnut crunch it tasted like a Ferro Roshea .

Last night 10/13/19 me and my boyfriend dined in for a date night. My boyfriend had ordered the meatloaf and he asked our waitress what came with it and she explained. After explaining she says &#34;if you want to sub it out for something you can&#34; he says okay and she lists some other side options. He opts to get the mac and cheese subbed in. Throughout this whole process it was NEVER mentioned that it was an upcharge nor was it listed in the menu to sub in the mac n cheese. So we eat and the bill comes only to discover that we were charged an extra $3 for the mac n cheese. We call our waitress over and ask if we could get it taken off because we weren&#39;t informed it was an extra charge. She immediately goes to get her manager, this is where the issue intensifies by no fault of our own. He walks over and says &#34;you had a question?&#34; My boyfriend explains that again we were not informed of the upcharge for the side and we would like it taken off the bill, mind you he never asked to sub it out she offered. The manager then decides to stand here and argue with my boyfriend for 2 minutes in the middle of the restaurant about a $3 charge. He was VERY rude and talked down to both me and my boyfriend, I have never been so embarrassed in a restaurant before. The main thing he would repeat was that &#34;we dont train our employees to tell customers it&#39;s an extra charge&#34; I understand wanting to defend your employee but it wasn&#39;t like we were upset to begin with or trying to pull a fast one, we just simply were not informed. At this point it was the principal of the thing and the manager ends the conversation with &#34;if you were to sub in a side of steak you can&#39;t be surprised when you&#39;re charged for it&#34; again he didn&#39;t ask to sub anything, the waitress offered. This is the way the manager spoke to us the entire time. I didn&#39;t catch his name but I&#39;ve seen other review on here about other people having issues with him, hes a bald man about 5&#34;10. We will NEVER be returning to this location and I will make sure to tell all of my friends and family about this experience and we may just voice my concerns to some corporate office. We wernt really upset by the charge itself but the way the manager handled the situation. Hire better managers or train your employees better.

Racist manager here. Bald headed prick. Hair in my food on my takeout order. Spent $130 and left a $20 tip. When I came back the next day to exchange for a fresh meal, the manager disrespected me as if I didn&#39;t have anything better to do. Horrible customer service. I have better things to do with my life besides claim I found hair in my food, just to come back and ask for a fresh dinner. The manager is a complete dickhead. Spoke to me in a condescending tone as if I was trying to pull a fast one. Who has time for this? Called Visa. F this place.

Generous portions, large menu selection, good quick service, and delicious food.  And don&#39;t get me started on the cheesecakes.  YUM!  We had a large group of 12 and I think everyone was very pleased with their meal.  We were seated quickly, and drinks were refilled well.  I recommend the lunch portions of meals if you are there at lunch...they were still HUGE!  And of course you need to save room for the Toasted Marshmallow S&#39;more Cheesecake!

I&#39;m going give this one a 3 star . Hadn&#39;t been to Cheesecake Factory in years . ( I just feel like their menu is all over the place ) has EVERYTHING! but I alway tend to order out of their specialty section . As we arrived took us a while to get even drinks started , once the waitress got there we order a appetizer , we waited and waited . By this time , we had a new server (because our initial Waitress was going home for the day) our new waitress was a great one btw out appetizer was never brought to us !!! The 1st waitress ever put it in !!! No biggy it&#39;s a Sunday , it&#39;s around 4pm &amp; it&#39;s busy and (we are all human ). Other then that our food was delicious as always and we got cheesecakes to go and enjoyed them at in the Confort of our home!  Not to mention the 2nd waitress was a great one !

Absolutely horrible! Went here with my pregnant wife for dinner; service was extremely slow, food was undercooked and severely under seasoned. Don&#39;t waste your money! Even the coke we ordered was flat. Cheesecake was okay but definitely overpriced for the quality that you&#39;re getting.

I went here on a Monday evening. I always opt for the chopped salad. It always come to me the same way...delicious! I had a glass of Reisling and end the evening with the Oreo Dream Extreme cheesecake. You are doing your body an injustice if you have not had this cheesecake. OMG! One slice is too big, but you better believe I will finish it on day two! <br><br>I sit at the bar and the staff is always talkative and friendly; offering area tips and must-sees.

Food was great. Service was okay. Waiter was not cheerful or ready to serve. It was as if he was being interrupted with whatever he was doing to take our order. I am used to cheerful people because they want a tip. Fortunately for him my father in law was paying!
Clean, great service and the cheesecake is off the chain! The food is always fresh and cooked to perfection. I also highly recommend brunch on Sundays, the pancakes is a must have.

Stood in line for cheesecake for 30 minutes. Not worth the wait. Said they were out of whip cream but they lied, it was on all of them, just didn&#39;t want to tell us they were de thawing our frozen cheesecake. Would not recommend.

3 words: Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo.<br><br>So much yum!!!<br><br>Always great and professional service when we go here!!! Also, the complimentary bread is delicious. It&#39;s a bit pricey, but you&#39;re paying for the atmosphere, great service, and gourmet experience. Love coming here for special occasions!
No I probably will not come back I pay a lot of money and I&#39;ve gone there quite frequently I feel that you do not care about your customers I&#39;m sorry
We had a great time. It was super busy and our waitress was still on top of everything.

The food we had was good. I had the filet mignon which was very good and cooked well. The mashed potatoes were cold and the green beans were cold and somewhat spicy. The other two in my party had shepherds pie and the bacon bacon burger and fries. They both enjoyed their meals with the exception of the fries which were sub par. The reason for the 3 stars is that the heaters on the patio were not on in warming mode and were emitting and foul rotten egg smell and our table as well as another table had to complain and the staff really struggled with getting it figured out. Our server Daisy was great!

Never had as bad service as I had today. If you get &#34;Erin F.&#34; I highly recommend you ask for someone else. I could understand waiting for food but waiting  for a freakin slice of cheesecake for 40 mins AFTER eating is ridiculous. Anytime I&#39;ve had a problem in the past the manager has asked how he could help. Nope not this time. Erin blamed the bakery for taking so long but others with other waiters got theirs quickly and no manager visited when I sent my Cheesecake back. Used to be one of my favorites places to go because of the variety and service. But nope! Never coming back. <br><br>Oh and I forgot to mention she brought a birthday  sundae but when I mentioned I no longer wanted the cheesecake she took it back until I raised a stink! Nice birthday memory for my daughter!

What the heck happened to CF?!!!<br><br>My wife and I were very excited to take our kid to experience what used to be a &#34;sure thing&#34; for us back in high school. It used to be that service and quality was above par here each visit. <br><br>While on vacation we visited this location. <br><br>Where do I start?<br><br>First, our server Erin was AMAZING! She knew the extensive menu cover to cover. Not just the popular items, she new each ingredient, sauce, protein and made recommendations based on our preferences. <br><br>At the end of this experience, the manager Adam was very nice too.<br><br>That&#39;s all the good I have to say.<br><br>The table we were sat at had a 2 inch by 3 inch chunk of the granite or what ever stone material the table was made of missing! The entire corner of the table. Luckily I noticed and told my 6 year old not to touch it. We didn&#39;t want to be moved because by the time I noticed it we had bread and drinks wanted to get on with our meal.<br><br>It took over 30 minutes to get our food after ordering. A party of 12 was sat next to us well after we ordered and they all had their food about 3 minutes after we got ours. It took so long that our kids were bored and ready to go. So we asked for boxes and took it to go. <br><br>Before we left I noticed that my Farfalle chicken was missing the chicken!!!! They took it back and added chicken to the dish. Also, my dish, essentially a bowtie pasta, was the same portion. Size as my two daughters pasta dishes from the kids menu. I paid $20 for a kids size dish!<br><br>We ordered cheese cake to go. Red velvet, Celebration, and Tiramisu. They were all just okay. I remember when CF cheesecake was to die for. <br><br>My wife&#39;s hibachi steak was okay. Not bad but not really good. It came with wasabi mashed potatoes. There was no wasabi flavor and they were incredibly dry and grainy.<br><br>In the end, the manager Adam comp&#39;d one of the cheesecakes, whoopty do.<br><br>We spent just shy of 2 hours and $120 on that experience. My server was so awesome that we still tipped %20. Everything else was lame.

I ordered off the &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; menu.  Not really because I&#39;m trying to watch my weight, but because I can&#39;t eat cheese and one of the only pastas without cheese was on that menu.  I also ordered the side house salad, which was decent, but drenched with too much salad dressing and the tomatoes was not a &#34;good&#34; ripe tomato.  I also ordered the chicken rigatoni pasta in red sauce with basil.  Nothing too amazing, I could definitely cook something just as delicious at home.  So I enjoyed the food overall, but found it all a bit overpriced.<br><br>The nice thing is that even on a Friday night they will take reservations for large groups.
I got a Mac and cheese burger it was really good. For dessert in got a strawberry cheesecake and Oreo Cheesecake both were really good. Also the staff was very friendly.
He environment is elegant. The food size is huge. The cheesecake was perfect, not like normal cake that extremely sweet. I ordered vanilla bean cheesecake, it was number one. A very big piece.

Just ate at this location with my best friend and enjoyed our little feast. We ordered two of their typhoon martini drinks which were AMAZING &amp; got their zucchini appetizer. Yum. We then ordered the combination meal with steak &amp; salmon &amp; that was delicious. Great service. Truly a perfect dining experience. Thanks Cheesecake Factory!

This was our spot for happy hour followed with dinner three times a week. Skinnylicious menu: My favorite was the fire roasted artichokes with the skinny cosmopolitan. My honey enjoyed the happy hour burger with a tall glass of Stella. Other favorites include:<br><br>**Soy glazed edamame<br>Caesar Salad<br>Chinese chicken salad<br>**Miso Salmon<br>The club<br>White chicken chili<br>**Chicken marsala and mushrooms<br>Tiramiso cheesecake<br>**Pepermint bark cheesecake<br><br>The bartenders rock: **John, Greg, Vince and Chase. Sit in the bar area and you&#39;re set. Great atmosphere, conversation, drinks, food and five star service.

My mom and I ate lunch here yesterday. The food was good as it always is. Our server started out ok and then once we got our food he forgot about us. He did walk by several times just never stopped. We had to ask another server for our check then finally our server came by to take the check and bring us our change.

I literally came for the avocado egg rolls! The dipping sauce that is comes with is a sweeter flavor and then  mixed with the salty egg rolls are a good combo!<br><br>For another appetizer I ordered the appetizer caesar- the thing was huge!! and this was the appetizer size? Defiantly could split the salad. <br><br>For main entree got the chicken Bellagio! It was good , nothing special to write home about. It&#39;s a flatten chicken cutlet over a bed of angel hair pasta and like a pesto sauce. To me cheesecake has this large menu but lacks the &#34; taste&#34; factor since they have such menu!<br><br>Ordered the red sangria to drink with the meal - it was tasty but I was pretty appalled that it was $9.25 ..I could have easily had three.
Do it! The food here is great, especially the spaghetti and meatballs and do yourself a favor

Our waiter was a BEAST. He was on top of the waters, he complemented me on my order and I will say it made me feel refined and important. It feels a little weird writing a review about a chain restaurant, but Charles made it a unique experience nonetheless.

I love coming to the Cheesecake Factory. Food is always really good. We celebrated my sister in laws birthday and had a great dinner. Meals that were ordered included the grande burrito, eggplant parmesan, spicy chipotle chicken pasta, and spaghetti cabonara. Everyone enjoyed it! The waiter was really nice so we ended up giving the rest of our cake to the staff! We will be back again for sure!  The only cons I would say is the lighting inside (pretty dark) and the pricing is a little expensive but I&#39;m sure people come to the restaurant knowing they are going to pay a pretty penny.

I&#39;m not really a fan of large restaurant chains like The Cheesecake Factory, so it really takes a lot to wow me.<br><br>That being said - this place is okay. The menu is extensive so there&#39;s something for everyone, however, since they don&#39;t exactly have a specialty, all the entrees come across as bland. My sliders we soggy and several of the other appetizers we tried were average at best.<br><br>Big surprise - the cheesecake is good. <br><br>Pro tip: Grab dinner at one of the other restaurants in the Biltmore area and reserve The Cheesecake Factory for dessert.

This place is eh. I hate giving a review this low but I&#39;ve given this location so many tries. I&#39;ve come here with my friends, had a pleasant experience. Came here with my husband and had the worst experience ever. Our server ignored us and was rude the entire time ! It was so bad I decided to contact them through their website and spoke to the manager at the store who sent us a gift card to give them another try. Decided to try them again, I got to go food today, two plates and a side was 44$!!!! We got the food, went home and noticed my side was missing! It&#39;s not a big deal to me, I know people make mistakes and things happen. We called right away to let them know and the manager told us the side would be taken off our tab. I ordered a teriyaki chicken with rice and I only ate my rice because the chicken just felt so slimy and gross. It didn&#39;t taste like it had been grilled at all. Almost like they got a piece of rotisserie chicken and put sauce on the top. The skin wasn&#39;t cooked all the way through and it was just wet and gross. My husband ordered Alfredo pasta which he thought was okay. It sucks giving a review this low because the hostesses are so nice and welcoming and managers are amazing! I really hope they are able to work out all their kinks and hopefully redeem themselves to me for me to go back.
The basic Cheesecake Factory in a mall. Busy, loud and takes awhile to get your food. The food is the same as most locations and our waitress was kind.

This place is really good and really filling. The only thing that isn&#39;t the best is the Alfredo sauce, it tasted really watered down. But everything else was good. The mozzarella sticks are amazing and I would totally recommend them. The waitresses are really sweet and nice. Overall a great place and good vibes.

We get here after long day of driving to Arizona. We sit down big group. Waitress rude she never asks if it&#39;s one bill or two takes everyone&#39;s order.    25 min later food comes out. , my daughters seafood pasta had a horrible smell so we tell her she says what do u want instead we order 30 mins later we get it .  Waitress needs more training she was slow rude never filled our drinks we had to ask others to do.  Would I return nope not at all

When going to this restaurant location specifically I recommend parking in the paid parking lot across from the entrance. It will give you a little yellow token that you can validate when you are leaving and will save you the hassle of trying to find a spot in this busy location. <br><br>Now for the restaurant! This is one of my favorite restaurants to go to and the only Cheesecake Factory location I really like. The atmosphere is very lively sometimes noisy and most workers are very friendly and helpful. The lighting is rather dim in certain seating locations. I would say it is &#34;too romantic&#34; when it comes to the lighting if that was a lighting setting. <br><br>Almost all of the servers I have had in the past were great with timing, knowledge of the vast menu, friendliness and attention to your needs. The food is always great and I have never regretted my decision when ordering. The Red Sangria and Moscow Mules were perfect for drink choices. I even ordered an A.M.F. (a dangerously blue heavier alcoholic drink. Those who know understand) which was not even on the drink menu. I was surprised on how accommodating this location was. They even bring an extra plate if you are sharing a dish and have split it up before. I recommend the Shrimp Bistro Pasta or Chicken Madeira for a main entree and the Portabella, Avocado and Zucchini Fries for an appetizer. Those are just my go to choices. <br><br>The only problem, as with every other Cheesecake Factory or Man vs. Food competition, is trying to reach that last bite and in this scenario it&#39;s the cheesecake. This cheesecake is probably more total calories than all the food leading up to it and it&#39;s worth it. If you ask for a cheesecake to-go container you will put it in the fridge only to open it up before bed and finish it.<br><br>I highly recommend this location and restaurant chain and don&#39;t forget to validate before leaving.
Always a wonderful experience! Food was excellent and service very attentive! Never a long wait during busier times.

The Cheesecake Factory is a well oiled, fine tuned machine. They have good food, good service, great ambiance, fun atmosphere, and reasonable prices. <br><br>The first thing you notice about Cheesecake Factory is how enormous and grandeur it is. The colors are beautiful and warm, and even though it is a huge restaurant each table feels tucked away and private. This is a great place for a romantic dinner for two, or for a giant group. There is a bar area with tvs for game watching, and a patio for when it&#39;s nice outside, so there&#39;s a place for everyone to be happy. <br><br>The staff is wonderful; everyone greets you warmly and seems to love what they do. The servers are extremely attentive, efficient, quick, and bend over backwards to make sure you are happy and get what you want. They know the menu front to back which is quite impressive considering it is about 20 pages long. The most difficult thing about eating at The Cheesecake Factory is figuring out what you want to eat. The menu is HUGE, and offers everything; pastas, steaks, gourmet chicken dishes, seafood, salads, burgers, sandwiches, wings, quesadillas, and even breakfast. You name it, most likely they have it! You would think with such a large menu the food would be mediocre, but on the contrary it is actually delicious. I have never had a bad meal here or been disappointed with a dish. They even bring out warm bread and butter to get you started. If you save room don&#39;t forget their cheesecakes, they are exceptional. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory is a great place for a solid meal any time of the day. You&#39;ll find something for everyone and you&#39;ll go home full, satisfied, and most likely with lots of leftovers!
Had lunch with my mom here. Food was delicious..as always. Service was good. No complaints. Good location and plenty of parking. A+
Fresh yummy brunch with a nice atmosphere the waiter was timely and the restaurant was clean
I just called to ask about their promo, and the girl answered me shortly and ended the call with &#34;Kay?&#34; And hung up. Lol.
Food was ok but if you like sitting in a ice box this is your place. Turn dooooooown the A/C it&#39;s 71 outside. I think my food would have been great if wasn&#39;t so coooooooled

I am not used to not waiting at least an hour to get into a cheesecake factory (that&#39;s how it was in south fl anyhow). I got seated during the regular dinner hour on a Thursday within about 10min of walking in. I sat near the bar area (not on a high top) and loved it because it was moody and cozy. We ordered the Korean fried Cauliflower bites to start and OMG,  just get that already! I&#39;ve tried cauliflower in so many different ways throughout the years and this definitely makes my top 3 list! Absolutely dee-lish! As a vegetarian it was pretty much salad, pastas without any meat (a little overpriced for my taste) or a veggie burger. The veggie burger was pretty good but I wish it either came with a cool sauce or when it gets delivered it actually has the condiments you ordered with it (like mayo, mustard, etc.) I waited about 5 min to get these (lucky for me, I actually don&#39;t mind room temp food). My server was busy taking an order at a different table so not really her fault. The pork chop dish my partner got was really great, my veggie burger was ok as were the fries. For dessert we ordered the 30th anniversary cheesecake which was VERY, VERY delicious! Took that to go because I was full. All in all, we had a nice dinner and experience. I don&#39;t eat out at chains too often but have always enjoyed my Cheesecake factory meals in the past.

Javier was a fantastic server for us this evening. I notified him of a severe gluten allergy I have and he was on top of it. I got the Brick Chicken and it comes with potato wedges and Javier caught that the kitchen put it in a fryer that would cross contamination and then offered to give me mashed potatoes. He made the night great, very kind, and high energy.
Being from Louisiana/Texas the food wasn&#39;t as seasoned as I&#39;m accustomed, but it was still delicious. The waitress was outstanding. The cheesecake itself, OMFG. My new favorite spot.
Good service, good atmosphere but the fish in the fish and chips were soggy. Two people ordered the lunch fish and chips and both had fish pieces that were limp and soggy.

We went to this restaurant to celebrate four different birthdays of my coworkers. The restaurant looks great, the food was fantastic and the portions were out of this world. We had a very fun server who was engaging it made our experience memorable.

Avoid this place like the Black Plague. Food is good but holy sh** the attitude from the lady at the register in the front is terrible. I&#39;m sure she thought I didn&#39;t catch her but I sure did... will NOT return to this location and maybe just opt out of going to Cheesecake Factory in general. <br><br>My .02 cents for her is if you don&#39;t like your job. Quit.

I just don&#39;t understand why the Cheesecake Factory is so hyped up!  I&#39;ll start by saying I have not been here for quite some time and was excited to give it another try.  When we walked in we asked for a table outside and then after waiting for 20 min they sat us inside, after reminding her we wanted outside we were told it would be another 25 min because she forgot.<br><br>Our waitress was useless, she messed up more things about our order than I could have ever imagined, and dropped two of our dishes upon bringing them to our table (This caused us to wait even longer due to remaking of our food.).  After always needing to ask for more water and asking three times for mayo, saying she was awful is an understatement.  <br><br>The only reason this place is getting three stars is because when you finally get the food it&#39;s always pretty good with nice serving sizes.<br><br>All in all, I won&#39;t be in a hurry to come back anytime soon.  <br><br>Return factor 15%

03-20-2019<br>Yelp review <br>Amal Al.<br>Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>I like cheesecake factory restaurants, and it is one of my favorite dining. I love most of their dishes, the feature they have is having varied menu. It is a place where most people can find their favorite food. Also, if you have children, you will not suffer to find tasty and healthy food for them. They have American, Italian, Asian, and global dishes which let you vary your table, and if you are confused which restaurant you want, cheesecake factory is a good choice that gives you many options. Their tasty dishes are a lot, but I love their pastas. It is well flavored and with balanced sauce. I like chipotle pasta and it is spicy if you like spicy and chicken pasta, I recommend it. Cajun Jambalaya is very good as well. It comes with shrimp and chicken, and it cooked with pepper, onion and tomato sauce. It is supper yummy. I like Their popular appetizer cheese macaroni balls, and I cannot go there with no order it, and I tried their lemon grilled salmon. It is so good. <br>However, some of dishes are not delicious at all because they use some strong flavors on it. Especially if they make Asian food. It seems not real Asian food, they overdo it. One time, I ordered fried orang chicken with white rice and it is Asian dish, I couldn&#39;t eat it. It was very sweet and with unnecessary added sauce. Also, my husband ordered Thai chicken dish, and it was over sweet too, so we could not taste the chicken.<br><br>The prices are expensive, and how expensive? that depends on your order. It is like most of dining restaurants that have two dollars in yelp. If you order expensive food like steak, salmon or so on, it is going to be more expensive. The good thing is their plate is big and you can share it with others, so you and who you are share with, will not need to order more than main plates and that make the total not that expensive. Furthermore, I like going there with my friends, and we enjoy their food. It is recommended place if you have your family or your friends with you.  <br><br>The service is good until it become very crowded. The thing that I like is they are friendly and helpful if you have kids and that what I like most in the restaurant. They care about your table to be suitable if you have stroller, and they are in general fast and helpful. However, I said before if it crowded, they become very slow and with untrained service. One time, I waited my order for more than 30 minutes, and they brought the appetizer after the main plate, and they gave us the wrong check, so I didn&#39;t give the waiter tip because I wasn&#39;t satisfied about the service, and it was horrible service. But that didn&#39;t happen to me always, it was few times only. In general, their service is good enough.

Very very poor service. We had a group of seven, which isn&#39;t large at all. Three people got the same meal of the Parmesan chicken and every single one of their side dishes were cold. I got the Baja chicken tacos and my rice and tacos were cold. When we complained about the mashed potatoes first they brought out new ones, still cold. We were tired of complaining consistently that we just had to deal with it. Our waitress was great and very apologetic the food service was just terrible. Very disappointed with this restaurant.
Had a turkey burger, was delish! My family also enjoyed their meal. Always a place to go to when we want something close to us.
The service was good but the food came out cold even after we sent it back. For a high end restaurant, I had a little higher expectation.

Ordered an old favorite, Italian chopped salad. It wasn&#39;t as good as I remembered it lettuce didn&#39;t seems as fresh and crunchy as it should. Loved the garbanzo beans and I added sliced avocado.  The dressing is still delicious though. I would order it again and ask them to please make sure the lettuce is fresh...

The food is excellent! The menu is impressive and the staff are always polite and friendly. Service is kind of hit and miss - depends on the waiter. Not always the most attentive. The food is always a win so I give it an A.
One of my favorite places, they have so many options for vegetarians and meat eaters! One of my favorite salad dressing they have which I also bought from them is cilantro peanut butter!!

One our favorite go to place with variety of wonderful delights! Enough said about what the food would have tasted like. The last two trips here have always been a nightmare NOT with the wait staff but the host and or hostesses   They stuck us back in the east side if the seating are with all sorts if open tables. Ince back there there was twi very large parties that were so loud you couldn&#39;t hear yourself think. We excused ourselves from the wait staff to be seated in another area. She said it would be 5 minutes. After watching several couples and groups get seated right away  and 27 minutes later without a word from the hostess we left<br>Wont be back to this location   Better to read the reviews and believe them!! !

Very good happy hour with very good prices. My wife had the chicken spring rolls and I had the fried chicken sliders. Both had very generous portions and tasted great.  Excellent service was icing on the cake.

A great place to go always. Nice bar area and great service. The banana cream cheesecake is my favorite cheesecake. Please be careful all of their menu options have like a bazillion calories but they recently started offering a skinny version menu and all the items on there are great. Shrimp tacos!!! Burgers !!! Uuu the appetizer stuffed mushrooms are to die for and I also love the appetizer avocado rolls oh my God so delicious! Nice date location, and girls dinner out. <br>..
Amazing low carb cheesecake clean, great service and great seldction per usual! Glad to have gone out on a whim and ordered the chicken teriyaki - high quality white meat!

When we got here we were spoken to right away which was nice. We waited about 5 minutes before being seated. The waitress was very nice. For appetizers we had buffalo wings and fried zucchini. The wings were very good and the zucchini was average, not a lot of flavor. I had a Patron margarita on the rocks and it was one of the best I have had. My boyfriend had a mango margarita frozen and it was okay. I ordered the fish tacos and they were extremely bland I had to send them back. I was very disappointed in them. Even the rice and beans were not that good.He had a cheeseburger which he said he liked. I got a slice of Godiva chocolate cheesecake to go and I loved it.<br>We sat at a booth which was stiff as a rock. If I do come back it&#39;ll be for the margarita and the cheesecake.

As we walked in, the front desk staff was very friendly and we only had to wait about 3 minutes to get sat outside. <br><br>Our waitress came to the table quickly and right away offered to tell us the specials. We alerted her immediately that we were there to enjoy dessert. I was in the mood for a piece of cheesecake and when I saw they had a pineapple upside down one on their menu, the decision was made. <br><br>Unfortunately, the pineapple upside down cheesecake was all gone which left me having to decide on another dessert. I chose the strawberry shortcake. However, when it arrived I was very disappointed. The shortcake was very hard and cold, not fresh whatsoever. On the top of the shortcake their was a sugar crust made with raw sugar. The strawberries were the best thing about this dessert. <br><br>I won&#39;t be going back, but if you do - good luck, this place is hit and miss.

The Cheesecake Factory was a staple for me back when I traveled for work - I always stopped in for dinner. So glad I live close to two of them now. The food is amazing and with the giant size portions there is plenty to share or take home. Love coming in for happy hour. You can never go wrong with the cheesecake for dessert. Today we had Rebecca as our waitress- she was amazing always had our beverages refilled and super attentive and friendly.

Me and a friend Marie G. Went to The Cheesecake Factory for dessert. As always the desserts were excellent. The server Megan was a great help with my indecision. She was engaging and funny. I can&#39;t express my appreciation for the food, service and the complete satisfaction I had on my visit to the Cheesecake Factory.

Was treated for my birthday by an awesome group of friends. The food was excellent. Always is for me. The cheesecake of course, was to die for. If I had one &#34;minus&#34; it is the lighting. When you have to use your cell phone just to see the menu, and I am by no means visually impaired, well maybe they could consider some type of ambient light. There was nothing. Not even a candle. A small pendant light would have even been good. There still wasn&#39;t enough light to read through the menu.  Waitstaff was okay as well. She might have been pretty new though. She did do a good job.

Tastes like dog food. All of it. <br><br>Like oh my god. <br>Worse than apple bees. <br>I wouldn&#39;t even give a homeless person this as a meal...... They probably wouldn&#39;t even eat it.<br><br>Bad service, took forever. I wasted so much gas waiting in the takeout parking spot.<br><br>The shrimp roll.... Had ONE HALF of a shrimp in each roll..... I guess that&#39;s the portion for real...<br>The sauces that come with it are garbage, inedible. <br>The noodles in it are gross. Overall a bad choice.<br><br>So disappointing. <br><br>Crab artichoke dip tastes like canned TUNA and rotten. I felt like throwing up after I ate it. Plus they gave me four tiny slices of bread for a huge portion of fishy nasty dip. Just pretend you mixed cream cheese with cat food and warmed it up... There you go.<br><br>Edemame, freaking soggy and salty...<br><br>Potstickers..... Tasted like canned chicken... Sauce was super strong and nasty. Looked frozen and microwaved.<br><br>$55 FOR THIS <br><br>FIFTY FIVE DOLLARS..............:::::<br><br>FIFTY.       FIVE.    DOLLLARS.        WHAT THE HELL.<br><br>I am without words. <br>I have been to a cheese cake factory before in CA. It was edible atleast...<br><br>This one was a JOKE. <br><br>One word. <br><br>DISGUSTING. <br><br>We&#39;re still hungry and threw it all out. Had to go get a burger some where else. The stand $6 for a burger... What a relief.<br><br>$6 <br><br>SIX DOLLARS <br><br>SIX.   DOLLARS.  <br><br>Cheese cake factory.... How are you in business ??? And how do you live with yourself feeding people all of this nasty food... I wonder how many people have been sick and disappointed from eating here...<br><br>Stay away. Go to the stand or honestly Taco Bell, McDonalds... Anywhere else... Yuck id rather eat pink slime from McDonald&#39;s than cheese cake factory ever again...<br><br>I am in complete shock that this nasty food is being served and people come here... <br><br>If I wanted to eat rotten tuna artichoke dip I could have made that myself and it probably would have tasted better than cheese cake factory..<br><br>You call yourself chefs... <br>Hahah. <br><br>Awful.
The best Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been too !!! And I&#39;ve been to many in different cities! The food was seasoned to perfection and the service was wonderful.  I&#39;m full and satisfied

Poor staffing. We were crammed into the entrance, standing room only. While waiting amongst chaos I noticed the whole patio open. It was dry, clean and perfect for the overcast weather. When I asked about being seated there I was told that the patio was closed because there was not a server available for patio. The wait to be seated was 45 minutes standing shoulder to shoulder. After finally getting seated we arrived to a booth in a very lovely setting and my hopes were rising. After searching endlessly for vegetarian options for our family I asked the server where on the menu I could find vegetarian options. He informed me that there were not many options and that they were randomly placed. He referred me to salad. Desperate for comfort food I ordered stuffed mushroom appetizer and angel hair plain noodles. I cut up the mushrooms to use on top the noodles which took a very long time to come out. I added a squeeze of lemon from my water and made myself a half way decent vegetarian meal. The noodles were incredibly over cooked and tasted more like top ramen mush so there was only so much I could do. The booth forced you to sit directly upward with no room to relax at all so before I had even received my food my back was hurting. To be fair the staff was kind and the cheesecake was very tasty.  Better to just order cheesecake to go and skip the whole restaurant experience.

Another Cheesecake Factory. Another poor rating. Just came in to get 2 slices of cheesecake.  And was not greeted no acknowledged me   And the girl behind her counter couldn&#39;t have cared less.  For 20 bucks for two pieces of cheesecake I expected better service.   And you should see the generic response underneath they gave back.

Don&#39;t go here. <br> <br>1. The server took too long to take our order. <br>2. We waited at least 30 minutes for our food. <br>3. I don&#39;t remember the server being attentive.<br>4. Server disappeared toward the end of our meal and we were basically left without a server at all. Other servers brought us a refill and another took our payment. <br><br>Environment:<br>1. The lights were SO dim I wasn&#39;t comfortable. I could barely see! <br>2. The customers dining there that night were extremely loud and I heard profanity a good handful of times within just one hour that I was there. I felt like I was at a dive-in bar. It wasn&#39;t my usual experience like at other Cheesecake Factories. <br><br>The food--<br>4. I ordered black pepper shrimp, the rice was so overcooked :( <br>5. In general, my food was less than flavorful. <br><br>Price--<br>WE PAID $70 for 2 of us, luckily I had a gift card to pay for part of that.<br><br>I wouldn&#39;t go back.

Our party of 10 had dinner last night and for the most part it was<br>very enjoyable.  The service was slow and some of the food when<br>it came out was cold.  Since my husband and I were picking up the <br>tab come to find out from our guests only when outside and saying<br>our goodbyes that it was mentioned by several people. My dish of<br>Skinny Chicken Pasta was cold and I had to look for my chicken but<br>decided not to say anything.  Our bill was $360.00 and not objecting <br>to that but the kicker was that my husband was celebrating his<br>Birthday and his cheesecake was supposed to be complimentary.<br>It came with good wishes on it and some of the staff sang as well.<br>After reviewing the bill this morning they had charged us for the<br>Cheesecake .  Kind of puts us off for doing our next celebration <br>at the Cheesecake Factory.

Came in saturday night around 9 pm ( 08/18/2018 ) <br>The vibe was pretty good until we were seated and our server came to take our order.. he was very slow and rarely came to check up on us. He then came and informed us that they didnt have the appetizer we had first order and asked if we wanted another one. When i said yes may i please have a look at the menu he literally made a face and handed me the menu as if like he was annoyed. We finished our dinner and he asked if we wanted a cheesecake to go and we said yes that we needed a minute to look over the menu and he rolled his eyes at us. <br>Overall, food was great.. just the service was horrible. We felt so uncomfortable. Which is very sad because we usually come here twice a week.
The clam chowder was very unhealthily salty. Chicken slider is good. Place lighting too dim. A lot of fusion style food. Good for couples and families.

Experience was always great. Ordered a Merlot to start off taste was a bit off but still a great glass of wine. Then whole wheat bread was always my favourite. Roast corn was flavourful with salsa and different herbs but I think they didn&#39;t pan fry it long enough. Then lastly shrimp scampi was awesome. Even though it&#39;s super garlicky and buttery. Almost could finish the whole plate. Overall good tasted great. Just that the server need to work on his service skills a bit more.

I got the Smokehouse BBQ Burger. It come with bacon on it so you don&#39;t have to order bacon with your burger, and fries.  The customer service was great and the waiter came to check on us often so we never had to flag him down. The food was absolutely amazing and I would recommend that burger if you like burgers.  I also got a slice of Cheesecake, because why visit if you&#39;re not getting some cheesecake.  The cheesecake is rich and delicious.

I&#39;m not sure what&#39;s going on or if this place has a new cook, but I ordered the salmon tonight and the whole filet was undercooked.  I ordered it to go so<br>I had to finish cooking it myself.  I ordered food a few weeks ago and I probably had 2 small pieces of chicken in my tomato basil pasta.  For the amount of money these dishes cost, I would expect to have cooked food and larger portions.  I&#39;m going to take a break from this place for a while until they get it together!

I dont think I&#39;ve ever had a business tell me I cant call ahead or book a reservation for 8 PEOPLE ahead of time on Satruday. I cant even call them 20 minutes before we get there and tell them to put us on a wait list. I&#39;m sorry that me and my family ON MY BIRTHDAY don&#39;t want to wait outside for what could very well be an hour. I understand that some places only take reservations for large parties and that&#39;s fine but... this is a large party. That&#39;s absolutely ridiculous. The lady at the front desk said I could only if I had 7 or more people make a reservation. I told her 6 were for sure coming and she said no. I told her I was expecting 8 and she said that now it all of a sudden didn&#39;t matter how many people I had she couldn&#39;t do it regardless? Um ok. No thanks. There are SO many other restaurants in Scottsdale and Biltmore that will take a reservation and won&#39;t put me through this headache.

9/30/2018 <br>Yelp Review <br>The Cheesecake Factory<br>Tempe AZ<br>Biltmore Fashion Park <br>2402 East Camelback <br>Phoenix, AZ 85016 US<br>602-778-6501 <br><br>            The Cheesecake Factory is an amazing  place to have a great dinner and to unwind and relax with a friend. Yesterday was my first time ever dinning at The Cheesecake Factory and it will now be a place I come to frequently. <br>            The food was very tasty from the beginning to the end. The sweet brown and regular white bread as amazing. The brown bread wasn&#39;t too sweet so i was able to still enjoy it. The bread was also brought out nice and hot so the butter was able to melt perfectly on the bread before I ate it. The white bread was simple but somehow even taster than the brown bread. For my main course I ordered the BBQ Burger medium rare which perfectly melted into my mouth. The onion straws were the perfect level of crunchy which allowed each bite of my burger to be soft yet crunchy which really sets the burgers apart from your average fast food burger. The BBQ and ranch Sauce mixture on the burger gave the burger a sweet yet refreshing taste. The fries were nice and hot and had the perfect balance of salt. Overall the food was 10/10 in my opinion. <br>            The Atmosphere and Service was fancy yet casual from the start. When i walked in everyone was nicely dressed and I was greeted by very kind words from the host stand. I had to wait about 5 minutes for the rest of my group of 5 to show up so I got the chance to walk around and check out the huge variety of cheesecake. The whole place gave of a professional yet causal appeal. The lighting at my table was a little darker than I would expect but the booth was very comfortable. My server was a taller man who was very kind and helpful from the start. He brought refills constantly and always checked up on my table to make sure we were okay. He gave very good advice on which type of food to get and even gave his personal favorite foods from the restaurant which was a great help to my friends who were undecided on what to get. His appearance was very professional and acted professional the whole dinning experience. The only thing I wish he did was say his name so I could thank him for his service on this yelp review. My server was also great at pre busing and was very quick to bring me and my friends sides of ranch and to go boxes.  <br>            Overall I paid 30 bucks plus tip for a great time with amazing food and some of the best service I&#39;ve ever had in my life. I highly recommend anyone trying to go on a nice date or have better food with some friends to make your way down to The Cheesecake Factory and you will not be let down. <br><br>James Jack Foley

I took my wife here last night for her birthday, I informed the hostess of her birthday and requested a happy birthday song by the staff.. no problem was her reply.. as we ate dinner, we heard 4 birthday songs being sang to various patrons.. we finished dinner and received the bill but no birthday song for my wife so we paid and left.. Our next Cheesecake Factory visit will be elsewhere .

Not the best Cheesecake experience. Out of the 5-6 times, this was the worst... here is why:<br><br>1. Missing items... No croutons on salad. No grilled onion on burger. No ranch as requested. <br><br>2. Bread was refrigerated cold.<br><br>3. Seats were dirty. Gf had to grab a napkin from another table to wipe off the seat before she could sit down.<br><br>4. Walked passed a bus tub overloaded with dirty dishes just sitting in a booth... not a good impression walking to our table.<br><br>5. Fries were not hot.<br><br>The food and service were good. Wouldn&#39;t recommend or return to this location based on our experience though.

Easy place to eat. Large menu. Got the avocado egg rolls, and the bistro shrimp pasta. Both are good except they should have put more sauce on the pasta. Serving size is HUGE, shared my plate with my mum and we were both stuffed. Service is a little slow... Didn&#39;t refill bread and water took a while to refill. The servers were very polite though.

My family and I (party of 6) dinned in on a Sunday afternoon and had a great experience.  <br><br>The service was outstanding.<br><br>Our server was Marisa and we couldn&#39;t have asked for a more patient and kind person to help deliver our overall experience.  I have an uncle who at time can be a handful with his request and can be extremely talkative. She handled him in the best way possible which relieved some of my anxieties. <br>The only room for improvement was the hostess. She didn&#39;t deliver the service standards that Cheesecake factory is known for.  <br><br>The food was solid across the board and everyone was satisfied with their meals.<br><br>Thank you Marisa for the great service and for ensuring my family had another memorable experience at the Cheesecake Factory.

My husband and I came to celebrate his new position. We had impeccable service and our food was great also. I had the Steak Diane and Salmon combo, while my husband enjoyed the shrimp and chicken alfredo. I chose to write this review because we also witnessed the staff accommodating a woman with a visual impairment. Her waitress literally read her the majority of the menu until she found something she wanted. Her waitress was patient and attentive.

We&#39;ve been here on multiple occasions; whether it&#39;s for a few drinks at the bar, a quiet dinner, or a birthday dinner for a party of 50. They always seem to accommodate. Although I&#39;d love it if they took reservations, they always get us in. Expect to wait to be seated at least 30 minutes on Friday and Saturday.

Went with friends on visit to Phoenix Camelback location<br>Food was marginal<br>Salad dressing was off maybe over cooked<br>Eggplant was but little taste<br>Salmon was overlooked <br>Too expensive a meal to not have the taste right<br>Service was very slow

This is a very nice atmosphere. It is upscale casual and felt very professional. The wait staff were thorough and attentive and the food was decent. The prices are slightly high (my pasta was 16$ without the chicken) but it was good. The dessert menu is the shining star of the restaurant. Completely in love with this place. They have amazing food and excellent customer service. I love the enchiladas and the orange chicken. I&#39;ve had different items from the menu and I&#39;ve loved them all. Also can&#39;t miss dessert. My favorite is the dulce de leche cheesecake.

This house sucks . They make you wait alot when you come deep. I fell asleep waiting . Man I was so hungry. They don&#39;t care about anyone just making money. Bad customer service. And the lady with the glasses was so rude.  The guys just stand around . They make people bleed . Like they let 20 tables in .

The Cheesecake Factory is located in a shopping center.  It opens at 11.  My girl and I had the herb crusted salmon, steak quesadilla and cookies &amp; cream cheesecake.  <br><br>The service was flawlessly executed.  The food was ok-nothing noteworthy.  Typical fat laden, oversized portions restaurant.

I was wanting a burger and debated between Zinburger and CF. One of my best burger experiences was the mac and cheese burger at CF, and I had gift cards, so I went there. I ordered the stuffed cheddar burger, and it was disappointing. It looked NOTHING like the pic on their menu. It was dry with barely any sign of cheese (the patty is stuffed with cheese). @ Cheescake Factory.. thanks for copy and pasting your response from all other review responses.. makes it feel real personal!...
Very good rib eye good service and valet parking. <br>What more can you ask for: )<br>Now would I go here on a regular basis probably not but it&#39;s nice once in awhile to enjoy.

I showed up for curbside pick-up and none were open because people who were not there for pick-up parked in every spot anyway. When I called to ask where I should park for my pick up I was transferred to someone who never answered. I ordered no onions. They put onions on it. I telephoned in an order at 6:42 PM last night, they said it would be ready in 15 minutes, so I arrived in 12.  I called them inside to let them know I was here per the instructions on the sign at take away pickup.  I waited and waited, and called back 15 minutes later and a young inexperienced person told me that she could see them packaging up to go orders so she was sure he was on his way out.  Again I waited, 15 minutes after that I called back and asked to speak to a manager, she laid the phone down and no one came back to speak with me, 5 minutes later I hung up. At 7:42 with no call back and no one bringing my to go order out, I left, they never did call to tell me my order was ready or to ask me where I was......  This used to be a nice location, I won&#39;t be back.
You miss the major point here which is quality of service as well as product. When we go out for a meal we would like to have a quality dining experience.

We had a VERY disappointing experience here Friday night. I called just after they opened to see if I could bring in a cake for our server to bring to our table for my daughter&#39;s birthday. The manager I spoke to was pleasant and confirmed that, yes, I could bring in my own cake, and just let our server know that I had brought it in. <br><br>I took the cake and bday candles to them early in the afternoon, and the hostess who took it made a note that it was mine and then put it in their fridge up front. <br><br>Once we arrived that evening, I spoke to the hostess (on the DL, so my daughter would be surprised), and asked her to tell our server Brandon that the cake was for my daughter and to bring it out with the candles in it after dinner. The hostess followed me back to my table so she was sure to talk to the right server about the right table/party. <br><br>Dinner came and went. It was all very good, but expensive, which is expected there. Then the bill came, and I tipped about 25% because I appreciated the extra trouble of them letting me bring in my own cake, etc. <br><br>But after the server took my money, we never saw him again - and no one ever brought out her cake!! NOTHING!! After we waited a while and realized it wasn&#39;t happening, we decided to leave. When I stopped at the front and explained what happened (or what didn&#39;t happen) and asked for my cake back, the man at the counter casually handed it back without making any effort to make the situation right!!! <br><br>I was so disappointed and felt so bad for my daughter to not get the the birthday fun I thought I had set up for her. <br><br>Bad job, Brandon and Cheesecake Factory. You really dropped the ball. <br><br>The next day I wanted to complete the online survey about my experience, but realized too late that having the receipt handy is required, and I didn&#39;t have it.

Loveeeee loveeeee.. you can&#39;t go wrong here, everything on the menu is awesomee!!!!<br>The Louisiana chicken pasta is a must, but minus the chicken cause I&#39;m a vegetarian, hehe. The skinnylious   veggie burger was phonomal, with their house salad on the side. Great vinegar sauce, ugh I can write a whole list here. Haha.<br><br>There mai tais, yummy.  Sex on the beach. ;)<br><br>RED VELVET CAKE IS AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!

WORST CHEESECAKE FACTORY IVE BEEN TO. I shouldn&#39;t even say been to! I placed an order to go an hour before closing and went to pick up my food 15 minutes later - and the doors were locked. The waiter was prompt and very courteous  My meal of skinless honey-crusted chicken, mashed potatoes, gravy and asparagus was great. First time eating a meal here. A nice way to celebrate my granddaughter&#39;s first birthday. Nice building. Thanks!

Horrible customer service and RAW chicken I had a to go order our chicken salad lotterly had raw chicken on it and when I called to Talk to the manager he was very rude did not care that our chicken was raw and just kept telling me to contact postmates because they delivered it it was not postmates fault for raw chicken it was the Cheesecake Factory who is in the wrong will never ever eat or order from here again they will get you sick and not care if I dident look at the chicken before serving it to my daughter and elderly mother in law they could have got very very sick and maybe even be hospitalized.
The All American Classic eatery! Today I had the Smokehouse BBQ Burger and it was outstanding..I successfully washed it down with a Strawberry Lemonade!
So great to be able to get brunch on Saturday now. Try the waffle with fresh strawberries or the Monte cristo.
Derek is the best!!! Genuine guy, just there to make people happy and provide good service. Go ask for Derek he&#39;s the #1 guy!!!

This is one of my more favorite places to go.  Decent menu selection and I love the Caesar salad dressing.  Tonight however I was less than impressed.  Our server was lacking.   He was not very attentive and slow in some cases chit chatting with some tables when other tables were waiting    Another server in the adjoining section was on spot.   He will get a less than typical tip from me as he said he would bring the check but it&#39;s been over 8 mins already and still waiting.  Finally it came. Wonder how long we wait to cash out.  He&#39;ll be getting less than 15% now.  Shame, this place usually has good service but maybe that&#39;s only when the server is female and can multitask.    Rating is 3 stars cause food was decent but service sub par.  And took 5 more mins for him to come pick up the check.   Ok 8/20 and here we go again. Order a Caesar salad and when it gets here it is shredded iceberg lettuce that looks like coleslaw.  They ran out of romaine but server never came back to tell me.  Manager is not even available to talk to me about experience. Think it&#39;s time for him or her to find a new job since customers service is not a priority here.  Will be alerting corporate now as this is become the norm at this one.  What a shame
BEST SERVICE EVER. Hands down Charles was awesome. It&#39;s not everyday that your server creates an awesome experience for you. Asian lettuce wrap tacos were quite tasty.
Excellent service and the variety of food makes a great place for family and friends. I highly recommend it as the service is fast and accommodating

Honestly have always had good experiences here. John and the bartender with the ponytail (sorry I never caught your name!) are so amazing! I come in every once in a while and it doesn&#39;t matter how far between I make my visits, both of these guys always remember me. Their customer service is exquisite and this is what makes me come back. <br><br>Not to mention the food at Cheesecake is always amazing and you get a healthy proportion of food. This is my favorite place in Phoenix!
Absolute horrible food and service. This place is lipstick on a pig inside and out. It doesn&#39;t belong anywhere near the biltmore. Stay away from this place.

My first time in a cheesecake factory in 10 years and the quality has gone down tremendously. Service was fine if a bit pushy (really wanted to turn tables) but the food was just horrid. Sure, you are getting big portions but the quality was so low. It was just a hair above canteen slop.<br><br>I guess the good thing was that it didn&#39;t cost much.

Awful service from when we walked in the door to when we left. <br>Right when we walked in the receptionist made eye contact with us then just ignore us so we had to walk toward her and say &#34;Hi&#34; first which is unacceptable. Second, she told us to wait a couple minutes to be seated while there was no waiting list. So she watched us walked out and walked back in and then she responded &#34; oh i thought you guys left&#34;. She was just terrible at what she does. Also, i ordered a chicken burrito with guacamole and without cilantros and of course they made it with cilantros on it. It couldn&#39;t of got any worse but then they bring my burrito with no guacamole. I addressed it and she said they ran out of guacamole. At that time i was almost halfway through my burrito. It would have been nice to know there was no guacamole before they brought out my burrito for the second time.
The SkinnyLicious Menu was outstanding this evening and the service was<br>above and over the top !

Three coworkers and myself came here for lunch at 11:20 a.m. on a Wednesday. The restaurant was not busy. We did have to send the waitress away initially as not everyone was ready to order. Once we were all ready to order, she was nowhere to be found. Finally she arrives and takes our order. An order of the brussel sprouts was placed to arrive before the meal. It did not. The entrees took a good 30-40 minutes after ordering to arrive, so by now it is roughly 12:30. We inquire about the missing brussel sprouts and were told, &#34;oh, your food must have come out first.&#34; Um, ya think? I got a margherita pizza that looked like a very bad grocery store brand frozen pizza. Very little cheese and what looked like a single leaf of basil cut up and distributed between the 8 slices (one sliver of basil per slice). Halfway through our meals, the brussel sprouts arrived. One in the party ordered an old-fashioned burger hold the tomato. It came without lettuce, pickles, mayo or tomatoes; only onions. The others felt their burgers were okay but did say they were so salty they were almost inedible. Service was not good and their prices have really gone up. We left the restaurant at 1:15! Two hours spend waiting to order, waiting on food that wasn&#39;t good, waiting on the check, etc. I don&#39;t expect to be back anytime soon.

The infamous CheeseCake factory ahhhh well the Service was great the waiter was very delightful. But the pasta plates that my party of 6 ordered were very dry and undercooked. Not a professional review

I&#39;m not big on chain restaurants but gave this one another try mostly because I was taking a friend and her daughter out for her birthday.   3 people - no alcoholic drinks nearly $80 with the tip, how ridiculous.   Mediocre service, which had to be hunted down several times for water and soft drink refills, they didn&#39;t even give my friend anything for her birthday.  <br>Best part is when we were ready to leave, we were told we would have to wait because their systems were down and they couldn&#39;t close anyones bill out - so 20 minutes and no apologies or discount later, we got our check.  It will be my last time at any Cheesecake Factory, they can take their overpriced crap and keep it.
The Cheesecake Factory is delicious. It&#39;s a chain restaurant so I feel it&#39;s pretty average everywhere. The service is always kind, a little slow in getting food out, but still kind.

Grabbed some cheesecake to go and well this may or may not be biased but their cheesecake just doesn&#39;t taste as good as I rememeber, that or I&#39;ve just had a lot better elsewhere. Reeses was delicious but let&#39;s be real, you really cannot mess up a Reeses cheesecake... The red velvet however was extremely lacking and almost flavorless (minus the obvious super sweetness). I&#39;m not a fan of processed food and pretty much everything that comes out of their kitchen (almost any chain restaurant) is processed. Too many gourmet scratch kitchens throughout the valley that I would prefer to support
Love this place. The salmon is excellent, the herb crusted salmon with mashed potato and asparagus is my personal favorite! Wide variety to choose from.

I met my girlfriends here to kick off ladies night last Friday. I am not a huge fan of the Cheesecake Factory, it&#39;s not that it&#39;s bad - I just prefer to try restaurants that are not necessarily chain style restaurants - especially when it comes to dinner style dates. However, my friends picked the spot and I obliged. I ordered a lemon drop martini and a cucumber mule for cocktails. For dinner, I ordered the alfredo but asked them to add blackened shrimp for some added flavor. The shrimp were on the smaller end and were slightly over cooked. The taste of the rich, creamy alfredo made up for it but it set pretty heavy in the belly. So much so, that I ended up passing on cheesecake. I think I would order off the small plate menu next time and leave room for all the yummy desserts. I had a pretty busy day so I was starving when the food came out - sorry, no pics of the food - just part of the menu.

Service was not so great and my chicken tasted really off and almost like fish... Also waited about 30 minutes for our check we decided to not order any cheesecake since our server took forever to do anything... Very disappointed. What happened to the cheesecake factory i knew and loved?

While on a business trip, we decided to order from here.  We ordered through the facility we were at and they handled calling in and getting our orders.<br><br>I got the Chicken Madeira.  This dish consists of pounded chicken breast with some light breading and cheese melted on top with a few stick of asparagus.  The side is a chunky mashed potato dish.<br><br>Since we didn&#39;t eat there, the food got to us a bit cold.  The dish was good though.  The portion was huge.  There were two chicken breasts and I only managed to eat one and half of the mashed potatoes.  Could get a bit overwhelming with all the oil from the cheese.<br><br>It&#39;s Cheesecake Factory.  It&#39;s a chain.  Can&#39;t expect some fine dining.

I LOVE LOVE LOVE the Cheesecake Factory. It was love at first bite for my partner and I, and we have made it a must in every trip we have made to Phoenix.<br><br>- The ambiance is very nice with subdued lighting and nice background music. Staff was always been very attentive and corteous.<br>- Portions are generous and packed with flavor (so far I have only ordered something I didn&#39;t fully like). This last time I got the Chicken Bellagio and my partner got the Pasta Carbonara, which were LIFE giving. We had plenty of left overs to prolong our Cheesecake Factory reverie the next day.<br>- the cheesecakes are always fantastic. I got the 30th anniversary chocolate cheesecake and my partner got the Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter cup cheesecake. Very decadent and rich in consistency.<br><br>The prices are a bit high, but it&#39;s the CF. You don&#39;t go to be all dietetic and stingy. All in all it has become one of the best chain restaurants I have ever visited.

I do love the Cheesecake Factory. You can&#39;t really go wrong here, Pretty much every dish is gonna be good. I had the Mac &amp; Cheese Burger. FANTASTIC! Just picture a juicy savory burger topped with a patty made of Mac &amp; Cheese. I loved it.<br><br>My only complaint is the menu is too big! Takes me forever to pick something, Everything sounds soo good. Not a bad problem to have.

Consistency consistancy wow what more can I say I&#39;ve never had a bad meal at Cheesecake Factory I often wonder how do they do it with such a large menu the food is made quickly and fresh and always taste great.

Yes this is a huge chain restaurant with locations all over the United States but this is a very good one. Every location has a very similar layout and decor, yet each one is uniquely different depending on the space or building it&#39;s located in. <br><br>The menu is the same though and the food is very good. Everything is very fresh and tastes great. It&#39;s a huge menu though which can be frustrating if you are hungry. We are talking everything from Asian to a simple hamburger. Not to worry though, you are going to like whatever you try. <br><br>My most recent visit I had the fried macaroni and cheese balls appetizer and a classic hamburger. Both were outstanding! <br><br>Staff is always friendly and if something isn&#39;t right, they will make it right with no questions asked. They can substitute just about anything on the menu as well. <br><br>Cocktails are pretty darn good too, there is a large cocktail menu as well. <br><br>You can also visit Grand Lux Cafe, Cheesecake&#39;s sister restaurant. Different menu, but just as extensive. Just as good too!<br><br>Enjoy!

Two hour validated free parking. We were lucky to get out in two hours. We were told it would be a ten minute wait. Ended up being thirty minutes. Once we were seated and placed our order for salads the food came quickly. The staff was running. They were either under staffed or didn&#39;t anticipate the crowd. As usual the salads are massive in size. We usually order one and split it. House wine overpriced at $9 a glass. The bar bill was $36 food  $21. The food is consistent.

I go for lunch or Dinner at least Once a week... I was really Disappointed When i asked for my Chicken Wings For my appetizer ,, The waitress come and told me they are out of Wings.. REALLY??? How can you be out of something .. Does every table order them ?? is that why?<br>SO &#34;Louie&#34; the Mgr came  over and said Sorry..we are having trouble with the Kitchen Mgr and his ordering.. You guys Suck!

Food is always great.   Never disappointed     <br>The Louisiana pasta with the Parmesan chicken is my favorite but with the penne instead of the bow tie.   They never complain or upcharge.    <br><br>A couple of times I wanted it but could get there so I used door dash to deliver.  Great partnership.  Love it.  <br>Always coming back to that fantastic place.

Way too much on their menu, I&#39;ve been here so many times I have my go to favorites now.  Steak Diane, Shepherd&#39;s pie, Chicken Bellagio, spaghetti and meatballs. The worst dish I had was the fish n chips they were either not completely cooked or a different style than I was used to, everything else has been spectacular. My go to place when entertaining guests or celebrating events.
